content:
Posted: October 23, 2016
												Well, gameplay wise this iteration is definitely the smoothest yet. I don't have all that much play time, but i can tell you in the couple hours i've played exhibition games its extremely smooth and a good time. My issue with the game, and the reason why it's getting a negative review are as follows.1. Awful PC support2k just doesn't care about PC nearly as much as consoles, as PC is the black sheep and the consoles are where most of the cash cows are. They have their whales on PC im sure too, but console is where a  ton  of their whales are. Whales are people who buy obscene amounts of VC, which leads into my second and most important point. But first, there just isn't the support console receives on PC. Broken Vsync, a 60hz refresh rate, blatant port of certain menu features that are extremely weird to navigate on PC. 2. VC has become the central focus of 2k, and thats unacceptable.We've gotten to a point in the gaming industry where DLC is extremely prevalant, and generally accepted. This is a mistake in my opinion, but i won't go on a tirade about the industry. 2k pushes microtransactions on you CONSTANTLY. It was bad enough last year, but its only gotten worse. The amount of grinding necessary to get VC incentivizes microtransactions through the irrtation and slow nature of progression. This was clearly intentional. To get into the practice screen, you have to go through at least 4 loading screens, so by the time you get there your ready to rip your hair out because you've done this 20 times. This leads to people spending hundreds of dollars to upgrade their player, which is ridiculous in my opinion. A lot of people use the justification "well lots of games use grinding, it adds play time." There is NO way in hell it should take more than 40 hours of playing without microtransactions to max out your player. Everywhere you turn in 2k games there is ads for vc, begging you to buy more. Its not enough that we spend 60 dollars on a video game, no. You also need to have a continuous stream of income dumped into the game to be competitive unless you'd like to spend half the year grinding away in extremely boring modes. Having everything center around VC is a blatant and digusting cash grab that i hope stops, but i know it wont. Ultimately, if your looking for gameplay only, i suppose its an ok investment. Honestly spending 60 dollars just to play a few hours of pickup games makes me feel like an idiot, and unless you REALLY, REALLY love the other modes in NBA, id just steer clear of this. I regret spending what i did on the game. Im sure when the NBA season actually starts my play time will see a jump, and ill enjoy what i play, but god are they money hungry.

content:
Posted: September 30, 2016
												This game absolutely sucks! I am so dissapointed that I wasted 60 bucks on a dressed up version of 2k16. MyGm has NO difference besides league expansion and a more stunning menu. They even took things out like being able to set your scoring options and other things along those lines. Forget not being able to play the pre-order at midnight, the game itself is a cop out. They put all their time into MyCareer and i'm sure the stupid card game too. Game play still is atrocious. Solid 3 point shooters are airballing way too often, the shot meter doesn't always stop when it should like it has lag, there are horrible fouls when the defense takes charges as you are merely running down court. Shooting is worse, user offense still turns the ball over WAY too often and AI never misses an open shot. Oh and about every game I have at least one player with his arms invuisible so you can see through his arm holes in his shirt and his hands just float. Annoying as heck. So, with MyGm being criminally neglected, gameplay as bad as I've seen it and an overall sense of playing the same game with more glitches I give it a 1 out of ten. Here's to hoping they majorly overhall this with DLCs.(I always play MyGm and start with high potential but, low tanking, young players. This is a video game issue in general but, when my players are lower ranked, they still shouldn't just make elementry school mistakes to compensate for the fact that a user is controlling them and making them perform better than their rankings suggest. I have NO PROBLEM losing, but I do have an issue with terrible gameplay when I am playing well.) Seems like they just don't put enough into USER Vs AI games since so many have moved to online User Vs User, which I have no interest in. Don't put something in a game if you are going to ignore it and put crap out there. So, really, if you can't make an all AI team play realistically against a User team than, you shouldn't release the game, period.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												EARLY IMPRESSIONS 5 HOURS IN:The best sports series in the world just keep improving. Runs well, looks gorgeous, atmosphere in the stadiums is amazing, defense is improved, the gameplay is vastly improved, My Career is a good deal better this year and the fun factor is out of this world. If you are a basketball or sports fan, pick this up asap.How does it run? It runs very well! I am playing on a 660 ti and a decent i5 and I have everything at highest settings @ 1080p, getting steady 60 fps (only time it has gone below was duing my career, every other mode it stays at 60fps). Also have not had any crashes yet.For me the most important aspect for a sports game is GAMEPLAY. One reason I loved NFL 2k5, Blades of Steel, NBA Jam and NHL 94 so much back in the day, the gameplay! 2k has ripped the competition apart lately, Madden isn't what it use to be, NHL has had a few bad years,etc.. 2k could put out a crap game and get away with it but this here is the best 2k in years and so far a very ncie improvement over last years game.Not had any crashes or low fps so far to, imo the pc version is very good from what I have played so far. I have also tried the xbox one version and the PC version compares nicely. Oh yeah and lastly there is WAY less hackers online, I heard 2k was going at hackers hard this year, but never thought it would be to this degree, well done (last year I saw 5 hackers in the first few hours I was online, zero so far in this).I will comeback and add more to this review as I get more time with the game. But as someone who has played EVERY 2k game since it started, this just might be the best one yet. So far my only complaint is that the srevers could be a bit better on MY PARK, while slightly better than last years MY PARK (where you meet other players to use you're created player against), there is still room for improvements.Unlike a game like ProEvolution Soccer, this PC version is actually very well done and not an after throught to the console versions, you can tell 2k put a good amount of work on it. So far this is an excellent sports game and probably the best sports game since Rocket League imo.This is the best 2k basketball game since 2k8 and imo the best sports game overall since NHL '94ADDED IMPRESSIONS AFTER 102 HOURS =102 hours in now, I must say.. this game has A TON OF CONTENT. My Career is improved aswell, alot more to do in between games and the atmosphere/presentation is even better than years past, it really pulls you in. Enjoying it alot so far*

content:
Posted: September 26, 2016
												As much time as I've put into this NBA 2K game, the hundreds of hours I've put into prior NBA 2K games, and also including the countless time I will put into this game from now on, I still can not, and will not recommend NBA 2K17 - or any NBA 2K game for that matter. I really do enjoy NBA 2K17: The MyCareer mode is great this year, the story is fleshed out enough to keep you interested, but not blown out proportionally that it becomes a laughing stock - especially compared to Spike Lee's awful attempt at an NBA story last year. (Not to mention Michael B. Jordan does a great job as Justice Young, the on court sidekick to your MyPlayer.) My only problem with MyCareer is that you can no longer simulate single matches without starting the match first and then pressing "Sim to End" from the pause menu. You always have to play a match to be able to do anything else in MyCareer.The mechanical side of the gameplay has really been improved, defense in particular; you can really put a good amount of effort in on D, and you will almost always have positive results, assuming you know what you're doing. Defense has always been a fault in NBA 2K games, you would often feel like you couldn't do much more than you did and still get beaten to the basket by the opponent. ISO moves have also been slightly improved, feeling less slippery, but also somewhat harder to use; you really have to practice the input timing, the distancing from the defensive player, and also have good enough court vision that you don't clumsily spin into another off ball player. I must say that sometimes it feels like the AI defense feels a little too good at spotting your movements; if you are expecting to drive the basket all the time, smashing the ball into the net, it is likely not going to happen, unless if  you are an NBA 2K master. The game really asks you to keep moving the ball around, because the AI defense will stick to you like white on rice. Moving onto what completely shuts down any positive outlook I have for this game. The single player experience is fantastic, in fact sit me down on a couch with a few friends for some offline multiplayer and we'd have a blast, but as soon as you bring the internet into the mix everything starts to go wrong. After years of NBA 2K releases you would think they would for once aim to make the online play work flawlessly, but that is once again not the case. it feels like all online modes are riddled with latency issues atleast 50% of the time, and sometimes the game likes to freeze up, telling you "WAITING FOR OPPONENT" but the game somehow still continues behind the frozen state. The My Park matchmaking is awful, actually there is no matchmaking - you would expect there to be some kind of balancing system in place to find a game, but instead you have to race other players for a place on one of the 9 courts, and hope a "squad" doesn't waddle in and steal up the match you've been queueing for, for the last 10 minutes.Pro-Am isn't the worst, but it does still have the latency issues, and not to mention that it often feels like in online matches your MyPlayer's stats are decreased considerably, as shots you take in Pro-Am, that would always be guaranteed baskets in offline play, often completely miss, no matter how open your MyPlayer is. The micro-transaction system has been hugely boosted this time around, 2K really want you to spend more money this year. And yes, I did - I know I'm only helping the terrible micro transaction system, but the grind it would take to get to a level where you can compete on a similar level to the other micro-transaction boosted players, and to even play at a level that is enjoyable would take such a long time that I caved in. I just wish you could carry your player over from the prior year, or just shorten the grind to level your stats. Either way after paying out for micro-transactions, you have to grind for a long time anyway to continue levelling your MyPlayer after a certain point, and that takes a long time in it's own right. So in conclusion/TL;DR: + Improved MyCareer, better overall story+ Improved Gameplay Mechanics+ Good offline play- latency issues online- Lag issues online- Unimproved matchmaking- MyPlayer feeling "Debuffed" online- Micro-Transaction pushed THROUGH THE ROOF I will continue to pray for the next NBA 2K game to be the one we deserve.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												For all those complaining about performance issues, worry not. Im running on a laptop, Nvidia Geforce 950m, i7-5700hq, blah blah blah. compared to a desktop obviously its nothing but for a laptop its pretty good. with that said, i expected decent graphics at least. when i started it up, the game was unplayable. Solution: make sure your graphcis card is on. desktops use dedictaed graphics all the time, laptops don't (to conserve battery). nvidia didn't update the drivers yet for this game, so i had to go into the nvidia control panel and enable this game manually. still not 100%, as it would be better if the drivers updated, but wow what a difference.Quick Tip: Update drivers. Check Geforce Experience, then check the website, as sometimes the Experience app thing can be a bit wonky, especially since the app itself updated.Hope this helps some of you out there.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												I don't see why all these people are having issues with this game...Lets first address all the "OMG LAG" comments. I have a GTX1080, 16GB of ram, and a stock i7 4790k. My machine is no slouch by any means, but I also stream at 1080P in 60FPS and this game still runs fine for me, those complaining about the FPS most likely haven't troubleshooted and/or updated their drivers yet.This is my first 2K game as well as my first sports game Ive owned on PC, yes it is strongly recommended to use a controller but that was no issue for me since I had a spare XBOX one controller laying around.MyCareer is one of the funnest experiences I've had in awhile, you create your own character (the face scan leads to some funny moments) and you can play on a basketball team and lead them to the championships. It does take awhile to get enough VC to upgrade your character, and the reach in foul calls get a little ridiculous sometimes, but those are the only complains I have.Now onto the complaints of the main game, Why in sweet ♥♥♥♥ can you not skip cutscenes? It also gets annoying watching your player (mycareer) leave your place every 5 seconds. Other than that I'd say this game is definitely worth the 60$

content:
Posted: March 26
												This game is filled to the absolute brim with bugs and glitches, that will never be fixed.  Many of the bugs in the game have been here for years without being fixed, the only patches that come through are directly related to their Virtual Currency, gameplay is not something that 2k cares about.  The vast majority of people who play 2k play the Mycareer and MyPark and MyTeam modes, so franchise mode is 100% garbage.  They have only slightly improved it this year, with features that should have been implemented YEARS ago.  Things like 3 team trades and veterans minimum contracts, just got in the game this year and they have been next gen for 3 years, and this game has been a thing for 10+ years.  That shows you how little they pay attention to the detail of the actual gameplay.  Every update has a new pack of cards you can buy but rarely to never is there a non gamebreaking glitch fixed.  On top of all the bugs and glitches, which are way way too many to list, the actual gameplay of this game is extremely slow.  You are not given an option to skip cutscenes, making each game much longer than it needs to be.   Every single time play stops there will be some camera cut to a coach or a player reacting to whatever just happened, and it is unskippable 5+ seconds every single time.  If you call a timeout theres a 10 second period where LITERALLY you are just watching the team walk to the side and it of course is unskippable.  If you want to play a basketball game and not watch a movie instead, this game is not for you.  If you were to play 9 minute quarters, I estimate at least 10 minutes of real life time will be spent waiting for these UNSKIPPABLE CUTSCENES.  This is not an exaggeration every single stoppage of play comes with 5-20 sec of unskippable video during a VIDEO GAME where you cannot do anything but wait.Some of the bugs in this game are just unbelievable, that show how lazy 2k is and how they do not care about the gameplay, they only care about how much VC people buy.Simcast, jumping into a close game at the end of the 4th? 90% of the time your bench will be in and you have no timeouts to get your starters in there, even though its a close game.  No coach would put their entire bench in the game while up 3 and 2 minutes to playThere is such a extraordinary amount of tiny things wrong with this game, that make the graphics useless.  It doesnt matter how good the game looks if it plays like absolute♥♥♥♥♥

content:
Posted: March 16
												Great game, the gameplay is solid and it looks beautiful. MYTEAM is very fun with lots of challenges and different things to do for rewards and such. MYCAREER is okay, it does get repetitive pretty fast and the storyline is a little too foolish for my liking, especially for a basketball game. I find the texting feature that your player has very annoying, also with some of the cutscenes being way too cheesy. It just don't suit a basketball game. Pro-Am is extremely really fun to play since you and your friends can make a team and play against other people online. This mode definitely doesn't get old. You can even customize your uniforms and arena which is pretty sweet. MYPARK is okay, it definitely isn't realistic at all, such as the crazy dunks, people dunk over you like you aren't even there and it's impossible to stop them. The alley-oops in park are also terribly unrealistic to the point where you can alley-oop people everytime even though the defender is all over them. But overall, the game is well done. If you like basketball, you should really check this game out!

content:
Posted: December 13, 2016
												I bought every NBA2k release on PC so far and for years now the series suffers from the same gameplay problems, mainly caused by the AI and a lot of canned animations and clipping issues.Your teammates leave shooters wide open, double team in the worst moments (double teaming Pachulia outside to leave Curry wide open? Yes, well...), sometimes even step back from a shooter to leave him more room.Players grab rebounds through the chest of defenders, balls fly througt outstretched arms and even torsos to reach the pass receiver. A 'fantastic' new issue comes along in all the long range passes by the AI, which lead to easy baskets because your teammates don´t get back fast enough into defense after your team scored.Also the players´ hitboxes seem far too big. More than often you get caught up in a player setting a pick you didn´t even touch.Especially the dumb AI on defense leads to very high scoring games (150+ points easily) in 12min quarters.And like each year all the oncourt stuff is framed by non-skippable cutscenes and wannabe cool conversations, mostly on your players phone, to mom, coaches and other players.The story this time imho isn´t as bad as last years release (Spike, what were you thinking?), but still very cringey. And it´s bugged as well: I traded from the Utah Jazz to the Knicks without my 'Orange Juice-Partner' but all the cutscenes and virtual social media in game didn´t take notice. They all act like the orange juice duo is still playing together.I really wish 2K would focus on better gameplay next time and put less effort into all the nonsense stuff surrounding the meat of the game.

												Offline this game is pretty decent. Mygm is great, and my career is decent. If your into playing these modes I would give it a 4/5. However if your in for myteam, mypark or pro am I got news for you it ♥♥♥♥ing sucks. There are hardly any players ever in the courts. 2K also refuses to put a cheat engine in the game and they pretty much neglect the pc community almost entirely. It is a grind to upgrade your player and its pretty stupid that they put attribute caps in the game. Especially for pc since online mode sucks. Only get this game if you prefer to play offline. Online there is no cheat engine. If 2k actually put effort into its pc community than it would be much better. Also it is apparant that 2k is vc hungry and wants you to buy the game. While I havent played myteam this year based on previous experiences with 2k if you want to get good players you haft to put in $$ gone are the days of realistic noble grinding and being able to field of team based on skill. Online mode its pay to win.

												This game is one of the best sport wise and if you like basketball then this is the purchase for you but now a bit detailed.Pros:My career -  really well made besides your nickname, I feel it being a bit stupid to be honest. If it is your first charter you're making, then the cutscenes are even enyojable, well a bit. I also believe that they have added option to skip them, which is really nice.MyGm/MyLeague - you get what you need, control a team(s) fully and costumize whatever you want. Nothing more to say because it can offer you to bring multiple championships to your favorite franchiseMyTeam - play games, get money, buy cards, play more, get more money, buy more cards. Intersting if you fancy grinding for somethingPlay now Online - pretty intersting game mode, you can pick an NBA team and play against other online players with different NBA team. Couple of first games are easy, but then the players get advanced and will evetually make you quit because you suck.Cons:VC points - pay real dough to buy some couse grinding for them is annoying, after the last update they even nerfed the gains even moreMyTeam online and play now online -  full of people who dont play but somehow crash your game so you lose without even entering the game, hope they get aids and die :) Also waiting times  to find a game in evening in Europe are quite high, especially in play now online mode, and when you get into a game there is a great chance that you will lose it without even playing itMyCareer - each time you will get a reach-in foul a fantastic catch phrase "I approve that steal. Presidential pardon" will appear and eventually drive you nutsAll in all you can buy it mostly for single player expierience, because playing online with other people will mostly give you cancer.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												The game is actually not that bad. The overall story is a huge step up from spike lee's mistake known as NBA 2K16 MyCareer. The gameplay is more refined and balanced. You have to actually work in the game to improve your attributes with the Doin' work mechanic. The charaters in the story and the cutscenes are likeable. I don't even think I'm finished with the story yet in all honesty. I also really liked how you start in college and go international for a season. Here's a list of the pros and cons in the gamePros:BalancedRefined gameplayDecent StoryGood sidekickBetter league transitionsCons:some audio bugsMechanics are new in the game so they're bound to have bugs and a learning curveOverall, it's a fun game.

content:
Posted: February 24
												This game is designed by people who hate basketball for the sole purpose of ruining the enjoyment of people who like basketball.It is so created with such poor intentions, I honestly want to know, why the people who created it hate basketball so much?Cons:Teammate AI: Painfully terrible. Off-the-ball defense is non-existant. You must control every player to not allow an open shots. So, just stick to star players... allow open shots for the scrubs... or play with 4 non-AI teammates. Teammate AI never runs to the open paint. Pushing the ball up the floor, teammates will run into the crowd and stumble the pace.Opponent AI: Always grabs passes over the top (Both with A and Y buttons). Alley-hoop has been broken in this version (double-tap Y to lob the ball into the air for no-one to grab). AI throw-ins always lead to turnovers. Contested 3's drop with regularity.Broken shot system: Open 3-pt shots get bricked with regularity. Lay-ups are blown worse than JV high school players. The trick to the game is to only shoot contested shots... for some reason they go in with crazy regularity.Passing system: Errant passes abound. Only stick with teams that you can icon-pass to the position/player you memorize. Otherwise you will constantly be frustrated by turnovers.Player momentum: Oh so often does your player not respond to joystick commands. Players will often come off their protected man by any sudden movement or player switch (A button). Momentum problems double when you have the ball and the AI tries to take a charge. Doesn't matter if you are using the R-speed boost or not. Charges have been made broken.Online play: Terribly long waits to find games. But if you do find a game, don't fret, because countless hacks are available for you to ruin the enjoyment of other basketball-lovers.Pay-to-play: Nothing ruins enjoyment more than being asked to spend extra money on a terrible game.Constant updates: Every day I play this I get the yellow udate icon in the bottom left of the screen on my first game in. And sooo much more... see comments for updates.Pros:None: this game is soul-killing.If you enjoy basketball, avoid this at all costs. If you own a previous year, you'll have much more fun just updating the roster.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												The game is actually not that bad. The overall story is a huge step up from spike lee's mistake known as NBA 2K16 MyCareer. The gameplay is more refined and balanced. You have to actually work in the game to improve your attributes with the Doin' work mechanic. The charaters in the story and the cutscenes are likeable. I don't even think I'm finished with the story yet in all honesty. I also really liked how you start in college and go international for a season. Here's a list of the pros and cons in the gamePros:BalancedRefined gameplayDecent StoryGood sidekickBetter league transitionsCons:some audio bugsMechanics are new in the game so they're bound to have bugs and a learning curveOverall, it's a fun game.

												From what I can tell so far, I would say that the game is pretty solid. Much, MUCH, better than last years offering, and even better than 2k14, and 15. Core mechanics are much tighter and the overall gameplay is more fluid and life like. This years MyCareer is a blast so far; only downside being those corny scripts which take too long, and forced nicknames (the game gives your player the nickmane of 'Prez'...wtf?) Overall the game is good with a bug or two here and there. I dont feel bad for purchasing. If your on the fence, or thinking that this is going to be spike lee's 2k branded toilet paper like I did, give this a shot. It's wayyy different from the last game.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2016
Product received for free
												Love the NBA? Want to play an NBA game on the PC? Yes you say? Well, let me tell you a few things about this wonderful game! Have you ever wanted to decide between facing an invisible opponate online or giving your computer a sexually transmitted disease? We have you covered! Either disable your antivirus while playing online or you will have to defend against invisible players in mypark! Have you ever wanted  to get a middle finger from an A+ game devoloper? Yes? Well, I have great news for you! You get two middle fingers for the price of one! You get one middle finger for playing on the PC. You will be the last to receive patches, roster updates, or anything else game related. That is if you get a patch at all. Does not matter how broken the game is! You get that second special middle finger because 2K released a buggy mess this year to all the special boys and girls. PC and console alike. Have you played a game and thought, "You know what this game needs? More random crashes."? NBA 2k17 Legendary Mess Edition has you covered. You can expect that when you upgrade your char, a badge you have already earned will keep popping up and crashing your game. Who would have thought that 2K would combine the great feeling of watching your character progress with the feeling you get as your game winks out on you? Pure genius!Are you worried that they will fix the buggy mess that makes the game unplayable? Don't be! Do not forget that you are a red headed step child in 2K Sport's eyes. Your step brother Jimmy will get that shiny new BMX for Christmas, but not you. No, you will get the greatest gift of all. Socks. There is a 7gb patch for the PS4. They said it is coming soon to XBOX One. They made no mention of PC though . So, the good times keeps on rolling with random crashes and players missing arms and legs. With all these unsupported bad ports, it has never been a better time to be a PC gamer! Do you love game companies miliking you for money after you purchase their game at A+ game prices? Yes? Well some more good news. 2K really stepped it up this year. Every time you upgrade your char, the default position of your icon rests on the "Purchase VC" button. So, you will hit that a million times over the span of upgrading your character. Each time you hit it, you will be lovingly reminded how much 2K really cares about your wallet. I know you are probably thinking, "Maybe I will wait to buy this Procious.". I get where you are coming from, but I have one sentence that will change your mind. Spike Lee did not write or direct for 2k17. Boom! You are now sold, right? I was too! All jokes aside: The game's storyline is better this year and it has better potiential than 2k16, but it is a buggy mess and it does not look like that is going to change anytime soon. If was not a Basketball game nut, I would not have logged the hours I have. I would wait for a good patch or not buy it at all.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2016
												So far the best NBA 2K in years! I am still in the first season of myCAREER, starting out low as usual, still getting drafted among the top 20. So while every other NBA team picks up a 70+ player (some are higher), the Denver Nuggets decided to pick this white guy with an average rating of 55. And with hard work and no (real) money spent, thanks to "Doin' the work" and generous VC gifts from ingame sponsors and becoming a better player, I am, after 22 hours played, already a 74 average player. And the growth continues. "Doin' the work" is actually an uncomplicated system, also gives you minor improvements for free and allows you to raise the ten skill categories which you spend your VC on (besides Badges, clothes and stuff for your private court).The story is actually not terrible. You team up with Justice Young (played by Michael B. Jordan) and form the dynamic duo "Orange Juice", which actually sounds completly batshit insane in the beginning but it's not as horrible as being called "Frequency Vibrations" in 2K16. It also unlocks a major feature of the game, the duo-controls which enables some great plays. You even get a voice that seems to match most ethnic groups you can choose from and the story is not horrible at all. Your mom only calls on the phone, your father is dead and so there is no major drama except for the stuff that happens in the team or if you decide to skip on (team) training. No Spike Lee is also a major improvement.Technically the game runs flawless for me except for some black players sometimes losing their arms in the middle of the game. If somebody could explain to me now why my player always has to walk so many ways to leave places I would be really happy. Did nobody test the game before and figured out it's beyond annoying?

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2016
												This is one HECK of a game!My hand/eye coordination is pretty lousy and I had reservations about trying a controller-based action game like this, but I am a basketball junkie and the vids I'd watched online looked absolutely fantastic.In addition to my lousy hand/eye coordination, I was a horrible basketball player when I was a kid and never played on a team or tried to coach later on....  Those factors and the fact I hadn't tried any sort of sophistacated graphics-based basketball game in any series for a long time meant I was *waaaaaaayyyyyyyy* behind the 8-ball on learning this game and getting any good at it.Long story short, I still suck, but not so badly that I didn't outgrow the "rookie" level in just a couple games.  Took awhile to get "too good" at the next level (its name escapes me), but I am now playing at "Pro".  There are three higher levels that I'll never get good enough to play.   Ever.Because of those six play levels, I can't imagine anyone getting so good at the game that they can regularly beat the computer at the Hall-Of-Fame level.  Of course, just cuz I can't imagine it doesn't mean it's impossible...  But it'd be reallllly hard to do. Anyway...  This game is flat-out *AWESOME*!  I've finally figured out how to successfully do stuff like dunk and get a good running game going with my now-I-can-dunk Warriors.  Nipped the Spurs in a tough battle just now...The flow of the game is terrific, graphics sharp and smooth, at least with my snappy new gaming-level PC.  Yes, this game needs quite a bit of computing power to run well with graphics settings on High.  I would think most reasonably up-to-date "everyday"-rated PC's would do okay on this game with video settings knocked down a bit, but to really enjoy this game at its best you'd probably need something pretty close to my rig (Intel i3 chip running at 3.9 Ghz, 16 gig RAM, Nvidea 970 GTX video card with 4gig rom).Thus far, I haen't done things like MyPlayer or MyLeague, and so far I have almost no interest in even trying them.  I've just played random games with me always controlling the Warriors.   LOTS of games!  Haven't tried any games against online opponents either, and don't really wanna try it.  So, on those sorts of features, I can't say anything.To those who are complaining about things like missing legs or arms on players or other strange graphics glitches...  UPDATE YOUR VIDEO CARD'S DRIVERS!!The few things I've gotten a little tired of would include things like the pregame and halftime shows (fun at first, but quite repetitive after not very long at all) and the really repetitive timeout huddles...  Oh, and the rather creepy-looking player and coach interviews where the lipsynch is rather off...  Fortunately, you can skip through these for the most part.Overall, this game just plain kicks butt!

content:
Posted: September 23, 2016
												This year of NBA 2k17 might be my all time favorite.  The " My Career" mode, in my opinion, is better and more immerse than it ever has been.  Overall I love this game except a few things that you may want to take into consideration before spending $70 on this game.  First, due to the ♥♥♥♥♥how of an offseason it was in the nba, if you wish to play online, prepare for players who believe that golden state is the only team in the game.  As you could expect from a sports game, it is somewhat laggy when playing online and has issues connecting you to games.  Wait timer seems to always lie to me or never appear.  This game is A GRIND FOR VC.  The my career is definelty goiing to be very time consuming for me as i have already put in 20 hours in a few days of owning the game.  If you dont want to put tons of hours into my career, then dont bother starting.  Besides that I love this game and only wished that online would be easier to run and more consistent with my wait timers. Hopefully these  bugs get fixed around when the season will start or in the next patch.  If anyone wants to play 2k ever add me as a friend and you can catch this L

content:
Posted: November 16, 2016
												Ok, so I have played this series for many generations now, since 2k13 and sadly every game has the same problem when playing against the AI. You're not playing the same game as the AI. It's borderline impossible to stop a drive from the AI if they drive you'll have to run alongside them and try to block their shot. If you try to drive against the AI It will almost never ever work because the AI's players have small invisible zones of no ballmovement around them and it's impossible to run past them. No like really, it's impossible.No I'm not making this up, it means that unless you have a clear path, like literally no one at all defending, you WILL get stoped and at best your player will grab the ball and you'll have to pass it. At worst your player will fumble the ball and you've made a turnover.This years version makes this even more frustratingly obvious because something that is "new" in career mode is that you'll have to grind drills in the gym against the AI. Sometimes it's just shooting hoops from one spot and that's uninteresting and tedious but manageble but then comes the 1v1 drills... they've designed a system where the AI is unbeatable 1v1 because you can't drive past them and they can just walk past you and you can't do anything to counterplay and they've implemented a system where you have to GRIND these drills. Makes my career almost unplayable.Now why, do you ask is it like this. Well because if it's not it's not very hard to faceroll the AI. Is it a good solution, no way in ****. The game is extremely frustrating to play and you will always have the feeling that it's stacked against you, because it is.There are some improvements, they've finally fixed the bug for some people where you could only play in offline mode or risk the game crashing the my career mode is less crap than it was last year but still worse than 2k15. The game is somewhat managable if you play a strong center and just avoid driving to the hoop alltogether. But all in all this is the same game as they released last year (and before that) with a new UI some minimal game changes and the only reason to buy it is because there is no competitor. FIFA 17 makes this look like a really bad joke in all aspects other than the, football is boring aspect.

												yes, this game franchise is the only good one, better than nba live and much better than freestyle2 basketball in the online mypark aspect, other than the fact that barely anyone is online, HOWEVER, if you have a group of 4-6 people MyPark AND MyTeam is ACTUALLY AMAZING, playing with friends, having fun, its just a never ending rivalry which creates an amazing experience. content:
Posted: September 24, 2016
												I "played" this game for 89 minutes.  I'll break down my actual gameplay time:-10 minutes total of character creation, menu navigating, setting options like camera/etc.-7 minutes of actually playing basketball.-62 minutes of watching a cutscene, the game crashing, rewatching the cutscene, the game crashing.  Finally it works, oh wait no it doesn't because it crashed again during the game instead of right after the cutscene.The cutscenes cannot be skipped and the game doesn't remember if you already watched them or not.  I watched the stupid Kobe MyCareer cutscene maybe 5 times, and that's a long one.I well exceed the minimum requirements for this game, as well as any other coming out in this day and age.  I'm not at the max specs either, but closer to max than min definitely.  A computer like mine not being able to run your game means that you are not optimizing your game well.I've played the NBA 2k series since back when Allen Iverson was on the cover and even when it was out on Dreamcast.  Literally my whole life has involved this game in some way or another.  It pains me to refund this game, the first time I ever refunded any game on Steam, but I just can't reasonably spend 60 dollars and then just hope that they patch the PC version.  And honestly, there's been so many problems with the 2k series since 2k15 that I'm just gonna stop buying these games until these issues are helped.Is this game good for a casual basketball fan?  Probably.  It has nice graphics and smooth gameplay like all the others.  But to anyone who actually knows the game well and expects certain kinds of behaviors by the AI, you'll be infuriated.  I already saw videos about how the help defense problem is still there, the shots the AI makes on high difficulties, etc.  The VC gouging once again back strong.  I just can't do it anymore.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15
												Update: 4/22/17 at bottom of review. Original review below:TL;DR: (6.75/10)The graphics and presentation are top notch but numerous gameplay problems hold it backGraphics: Awesome (9/10)2k has been getting this part right for a while. The players and courts look realistic and move in realistic ways (at least most of the time) The only problem I could point out is that some textures are inexplicably blurry despite being in a high resolution. This is easily countered by using something like ReShade to boost the sharpness, but it's worth pointing out.Presentation: Awesome (9/10)Any 2k fan worth their salt will tell you that this series has perhaps the best presentation of any sports game series. The commentary is organic and lifelike and the presentation is top notch. The attention to detail really shows! However, like graphics, there is one small problem worth pointing out: There's so much presentation that you have to mash the "A" button after just about every basket and especially before the game/after the game/between quarters to skip all of the flashy presentation just to get back to the gameplay with no way to turn it off.Game modes: Awesome (9/10)Ok, I admit, I've given the game a lot of credit with three straight 9 of 10's. The thing is that these three things are the things that 2k does better than ANYONE ELSE IN SPORTS GAMING. In fact, they've been the best since at least 2k11. There are so many game modes and each one of them is very well fleshed out. Only a handful of changes would make them better, and they're pretty much irrelevant. Customization: Good (7/10)2k is better than most when it comes to customization, but there is so much room for improvement here that if you're looking for a fully customizable experience, you won't feel disappointed, but there are other games that do just as good or better. One thing to note is the team relocation mechanic that allows you to fully customize the NBA and even add up to 6 teams to the assosiation in a variety of game modes. The problem for people who love to customize (Like myself) is that this option is ONLY available in certain modes and is not normally available through the main customization tools like player creation and roster editing. This is a major disappointment, and really needs to be remedied in 2k18 (or even patched into this game)!Gameplay: Passable (5/10)Here it is, the one thing 2k17 struggles with heavily! Unfortunately, this is the single most important part of the game for 99% of people! Here's a list of just some of the most glaring issues. (Many of these carry over from 2k15/2k16)-The game is slower than real life, players jog around the court and take floaty shots (set gamespeed to around 55-60 to fix this easily)-Animations are sluggish, this is especially the case with dribble moves as they are useless most of the time-It's entirely too easy to get drawn into animations, just run into the back of a player on a fast break to force them to slow down and let you get beside them or even pass them up while rarely drawing a foul in the process-The AI is all-knowing, making plays with its back turned on a regular basis and simply stands around rather than rotating on defense or getting open on offense-Layups are too easy to make meaning running toward the rim and spamming them is usually a winning strategy even on higher difficulties-Fouls are too easy to rack up as they get called too often-And-ones go in on a regular basis rather than making fouls mean something-Speed is non-existant in this game as players like Shaq can keep up with Allen Iverson in most situations-"FAST BREAK, WHAT FAST BREAK? PLAYERS DON'T HAVE UNCONTESTED FASTBREAKS!" says the game. In 200+ hours I've had 1, YES 1, uncontested fastbreak despite telling players to run in transition-Invisible walls on the edge of the court put on extra "Player Repellant" this year, meaning that you can sometimes run head first out of bounds and get knocked back in by nothing to keep you in play-The mid range shot is useless in this game, open or not. Unless you're Michael Jordan.-Dunking in traffic is nearly impossible, leading to easy blocks on most of them even if you go up with two hands. Unless you're Michael Jordan.-Most of all, the game often considers "well contested" shots that would normally be open rendering stepback J's and shooting from screens pointless.If there are so many gameplay problems, then why recommend the game? Because most of the issues can be fixed by creating your own sliders for the game. After tweaking the settings, I would say that it gets closer to a 7.5/10 or so. If you don't want to make your own, then you can always download someone else's sliders, even mine if you want. The thing is that even my sliders aren't perfect and are constantly being updated for realism/balance/fun.Update: 4/22/17The latest gameplay patch: 1.12 just dropped a few days ago and I decided to go back to defaults to see if it is better. It is.The points below only apply to the Gameplay portion of the review and to nothing else.-Dribble moves are no longer useless, but body-up sensitivity is still way too high by default.-3pt shooting is no longer OP, but they nerfed it too hard. It's impossible to hit 40% with Steph without tweaks to sliders.-Mid range still garbage.-Players no longer lube up their hands before every game, but still lose the ball too often.-Layups and inside shots haven't been touched at all, still way too good. (Set sliders to 40-ish)-Shots still contested from 5+ feet away.All in all, this update changed the game from a balance of high scoring Inside/Outside ball, to Isolation/Post up/Get to the rim ball. Just foul out the other team's center by driving inside all game and hitting around 50% of fouled shots to get your three pointers the old fashioned way.

content:
Posted: January 10
												So after finishing my 1st season as an NBA Pro winning Rookie of the Year as well as taking home the Title for my team Utah Jazz, I decided to take my talents elsewhere. I had suspected early on with the new "Orange Juice" thing that you're pretty much going to be stuck with Justice Young for the rest of your career. Well I was correct, I get signed to a new team in hopes of going solo but no Justice just came along with me, which I don't understand how teams could afford both of our salaries but whatever. I get that Michael Jordan is a big perk for the game but it's almost too easy considering you have another teamate that will for sure put up numbers for your team so the whole time it's like having a handicap in which I don't like about MyCareer.    Also If you're a fan of the series or have been and played through 13-16, you will notice that Jackson Ellis appears in these games as well, I've made it my personal mission to not accept any requests to hangout with him due to he's a d-Bag in the other games, long time rival, blah blah blah. Screw Ellis he sucks ain't even on the same level. Game mechanics are dope, some of the dunks are gone but nothing that damages the game... There are many of the game modes that I haven't gotten a chance to play around with yet but overall the game is just what you would expect from 2K nice solid gameplay, a few hiccups here and there but If you're decent at the game you will fly through games with a pretty nice stats.   I don't usually rate games but this one I will have to give a 8.5 out of 10 mainly because of the Justice Young thing in MyCareer, somehow 2K finds a way to screw with the MyCareer when all we really want is to work our way up from the bottom, dominate, collect badges, get buckets, make VC, without a whole story pre-made... If they gave the option like a multi-layer choice based system, I don't see why this game couldn't take on other franchises such as FIFA which does a phenomenal job at everything they do with that game. That being said, pick it up cheap or wait until next year or keep playing the previous year because you're not missing too much.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2016
												This game is unbelievably bugged. I've played only for a few hours but have already experienced several bugs1. I've caught the time running while waiting to inbound a pass2. CPU started intentionally fouling me when there is like 50seconds left and im only up by 1. And when I did get fouled through the bonus it only gave me one shot instead of two. LOL?3. Even after tampering with Vertical sync all of my cut scenes are still being played at 3x regular video speed, and 1x audio speed and always end abruptly without seeing all of the content.4. Just did one of my first shoot arounds on myplayer, I was almost completely done filling that top practice bar then all the sudden the practice teammate started derping around trying to pickup the ball. It went on for 20 minutes and wouldn't allow any button on controller or keyboard to exit/save or anything. I had to alt-f4 and lose the experience. the Cpu ran around the court non stop trying to pick up the same basketball.5. Want to play with a 360 controller and a ps4 controller with a friend? Goodluck. Causes massive issues and constantly randomly disconnects your controller. You seem to have to use the exact same controller for every player.More things I don't like:1) MyTeam is confusing, It may have been like this in other games but why.. I make a team, My court is defaulted to the Hawks, yet Im from New York, Scoreboard says Timberwolves and i'm wearing the wizards jerseys. Like wtf. Who approves this stuff? 2K, your desire for dlc/paid content has gone too far and its just straight up confusing for new players.2) Curry is just ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ly op. I know hes insane in real life. I love to watch it. But I played against a friend who I normally beat with the Knicks. He dropped 42 points with curry himself in one game. 80% of those shots were deep, chuck shots over coverage. Like 40 footers under heavy coverage..  42 points, (and this is half game length of real life. So essentially on track for 84 points in real life. And he is a noob like me taking low percentage shots. I understand he should be really good. But thats just ridiculous. The sliders were on default - Pro difficulty3) The substitution/timeout design is horrid. 2k16 was wayy better and user friendly. Its very awkward trying to read all these player names sideways and upside down. It is also very awkward to access the other menus like setups/defensive tendencies.4) PC online gameplay forces you at 60fps. I want to use my 144hz monitor!5) No chat box/quick comms like Rocket League, On the MyPark blacktop there no way to communicate with other players

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 7
												NBA 2K series are one of my fav out there, and every year since 2K9 I'm playing best sports game. 2K17 is no different, it's the best sports game I've played, and it's my go-to chill back and relax game next to Fifa 17. I love basketball and it's a big part of my life, so I have to own a basketball sim game always :) 2K17 is a very fun but complex game, you have to set sliders a bit for your own preference and to get that near to real-world stats if you want, and it has it's flaws, but it's constantly improved and rosters are up-to-date. Graphics are SICK! Game runs smooth, but occasionaly I experience some stuttering here and there, but nothing serious. Game is awesome, if you want offline and/or offline fun, this game is for you. I didn't even touch some of the game features and still have fun, so, to cut the story short - I recommend this game and just wish I have more time to play it :)

Posted: September 27, 2016
												我觉得这是2k系列里最差的一部，我几乎每天网上睡觉前都会玩一局，我从2k13一直玩到现在从来没对游戏这么失望过，如果不是死忠粉就不要买了太差bug：1.创建角色里深色皮肤到游戏里显示深色皮肤绿色脸 2.非常深的板凳球员到场上来打垃圾时间显示没有胳膊 3.裁判经常拿着球不给你（超过一分钟），尤其是边线发球和罚球玩法： 1.抢断太简单，两个后卫一见面按一下抢断就立即掉球或者抱住不动，如果遇到抢断比较好的就直接一下断下来了 2.投篮防守对投篮的影响非常小，能投进就是能投进，不能投进就是不能投进 3.回场不敏感，半只脚过去了都不吹 4.主场优势太大，边缘球员可以在主场优势下疯狂进球，明星球员就是进不去一个 5.为什么有时候明明投篮条都绿了还投不进 6.经常看到对面电脑各种乱运球转身然后球还没拿就一个三分进了（还是那种不怎么会投三分球的）

content:
Posted: October 16, 2016
												Definitely an improvement over last year. Everything is much deeper, sharper, and with way less Spike Lee nonsense. The graphics look better than ever, and play is smooth as butter. If you're playing online, the northeastern servers seem to be great. The MyPark is better than ever. I'd have to say the biggest update this year is all the dope gear though, the shoes, the tattoos, and the improved facescan phone app. VC is more fun that ever to earn. My only gripe about this game is the occassional dumb bug. It's understandable within the first month of the game being released. The only thing that I can remember specificially was my expansion team's jerseys were acting weird. For some reason print wouldn't show up.Note to the wise - when using the face scan, relax your eyes as much as possible. The larger your eyes are, the more likely they are to come out in game very buggy, almost alien eyed like in the old maddens.Overall, the game is a 9/10 in my book. I just don't give 10's out. A ten is a game that would make me want to quit my job, and trust me this one comes close lol.Highly reccommend, especially on PC, as we need to grow the 2k community on here as much as possible. The Pro-Am's are pretty sweet this year.

content:
Posted: October 5, 2016
												Mechanics are great, animations are great, VC Grinding is bad but what the heck.This game had it all on point and with Spike Lee gone, it kills me to not play it. Cheaters in MyPark are slowly getting banned and that should calm most buyers down as I have not seen any non-legit 90+ overall so far as I'm concerned. Its pretty easy to get to 90 on MyCareer in a week or two. This game has whole lots of fixes. It runs great on my GTX 980 at 60hz with VSync ON. My only problem is that at 120 hz, all the cutscenes get messed up and fast forwards all the time and is as expected as this was noted by 2k while changing your refresh rate settings. Overall, this game is worth the buy if you have the time to play it but not a great buy when time is a big factor for you in playing this game's modes other than casual "Play Now!" gaming.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2016
												NBA2K17... Where do I begin... To begin with, I have played NBA since 2010 and seeing the game evolve makes me happy, but there are still some major issues that the devs have to deal with, which I feel like should've been fixed by nowPros:+ Graphics and player faces looks amazing, this is the most realistic nba game ever made imo+ MyCareer being better than ever and all the other modes too! Really enjoy playing everything+ If you're a MyTeam fan, you will most likely get content each weekI wish I could add more pros for this game but there are too many issues I feel like to do so for now...Cons: - Glitches and animations while playing matches, for an instance, some bodyparts of some players would dissapear, and all the BS animations that you are familiar from earlier games still exist to some degree. - A program called Cheat Engine is used to modify the game, MyTeam for the most part. On console, the max you can list a player for is 100k, but using cheat engine, the price can be set to whatever creative amount you want, and to some degree this is game-braking... Especially if you're going to collect 2.5K cards for the best card in the game (debatable) this also makes VC useless in MyTeam since you're going to need a s*** loads of MT to afford just a 87-89 rated card... This has been a problem for 3 years so do not expect a patch...- VC is very overpriced (IMO) and VC ( the currency used in NBA2K games ) is pretty much needed for most activites within the game... The game is really fun but if you're going to buy it, you should get it for console if you have the chance. Would not recommend buying it on PC if you're going to play MyTeam, but every other mode should work fine...Giving this game a 7/10 simply because of the graphics and great modes , would've given higher if 2K would start work on theese PC problems that has existed for a long time

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16
												Best basketball game out there, but they spent too much time developing things in the game that nobody uses at all, like the trading cards, instead of focusing on what people really want, which is a seamsless online multiplayer experience, which this game does NOT have....you can take you custom player and play in myPark like the 1 on 1 or 2vs 3 vs 3 street games, on the PC version only, because there are never any other players for matchmaking for regular online NBA team games, where players traditionally take their team and vs. other players teams online....like for example, you play as the warriors, and somebody else online pays as the pistons or whatever....also the team you are on in your career is not possible to be played with online at all, only your individual player in mypark...straight bull in my opinion, and the deal breaker?...THIS GAME HAS NO VOICE CHAT FOR PC!....So even if the online community was bigger than 20 peoples in the world playing at a time, and you coullld actually find somebody in matchmaking to play against?...you wouldnt even be able to communicate with them....same applies for your pick-up games in my park, literally no way at all to communiate with the players. if you are planning to purchase this game for anything other than the career mode, which is lacking and quite reptative imo aslo...DON'T DO IT...I made that mistake, and I shouldve just stuck with 2016, and I honestly would have if I would;ve known that a game company would release a game in 2017 that is an online multiplayer SPORTS game to top it of....that has....no...communication options...no voice chat....no text chat...nothing at all...and there are literally never more than about 10 people online during the afternoon prime-time, and if you want play with somebody in my park (dont know why you would, its nno fun without communication) other than between the hours of 5pm-10pm?...yah, good luck cuz it isnt going to happen. HORRIBLE WASTE OF MONEY AND I WOULD TAKE A REFUND INSTANTLY IF THAT WERE AN OPTION, BECAUSE I DIDNT KNOW ANY OF THESE THINGS UNTIL A WEEK AFTER I BOUGHT IT, and tried to go online for my first time, because I wanted to buld my character up first...I went to mypark at about 2am....and there was literally nobody there for a half hour straight until i gave up, and went online to the forums to see why that was, and come to find out, the online community is so small, that there is hardly ever anybody to play with...literally not 1 single person outside of the prime-hours, and ever if it were flooded with players? nope, still absolute horse crap because when theirs no communication between you and other players at all, what the hell is the fun in that? More fun to play vs. the AI...Literally...So yah, just take my word for it, and unless this game is $10 or less, don't buy it because you will be greatly dissapointed with 80% of the game....the only 20% you will like, is the myCareer mode, which once again, is lacking in an interesting story greatly, and is extreeeemely repetative....so IMO this game is good for a week of entertainment before you get completely bored with it. and for that? No more than $10.

												After playing a good 100 hours I can give my review,however I only play mycareer so its based on only this mode.It;s a good looking game again this year and quite fun,probably the best 2k I played at least.I like the new training instead of the old mode,having said that I do miss some old featsures like GM meetings and the options you had there.The gameplay is good ,the animations are good..until..yes until the cpu decides to start the 2k cheese.2k has always denied that they put in a program to basically screw you at times,sometimes more,sometimes less.The fact remains is that every single player experiencing this game will admit that the cpu often will flat out cheat you and it's no dofferent this year.After a 100 hours I am at a point where it then becomes frustrating and you get mad rage.If you love basketball this is still the best experience you will get in a video game,however if you already have a 2k version there isnt much need to get the newest,seeing they capped us this year and it quite honestly becomes more silly with every new version of 2k.This game is a mixed experience really and I would rate it a 6/10.

Posted: September 21, 2016
												This game was released pretty much as an incomplete product for pc. All games I've tried, be it myteam, mycarreer or play now leave me with just 2 minutes left in the 4th quarter. Like its still a demo version or something? Blacktop doesnt work at all. Loads the game then bugs out, saying you complete the game and that its saving points to your account. Character models for certain plers are floating heads with hands and feet. Really a pathetic release. Controls as usual are wonky without a controller, which begs the question why not go back to the 2k15 controls for pc, those were MUCH more fluid.All in all i feel as though i♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥away 100$ on a game that they probably wont patch or update for a while. Very disappointed 2k. With the collosal failure that was 2k16 on pc. I was expecting something good.

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 12, 2016
												-RPG basketball gameYou play as one character for one position.Can choose an "archetype" that pairs with your position. RPG nerds rejoice!Earn virtual currency from games to pay for more stats.-Lots of contentThere's lot of other modes: be manager of a team, simulate your own league, play online as one player or team. In multiplayer team mode, you collect cards that give your team better players and boosts.One player mode has lots of cutscenes well acted and entertaining and I feel a deep connection to the characters, deeper than some RPGs I played.So many animations and well blended, so many commentary variations, good music selection, can even make your own content.Well worth $60 - can buy cheaper from elsewhere-very steep learning curveTo this day I can't get defense down even as "lockdown defender", feels like you're on rollerskates on the floor or a car (i'm 93 overall). Impossible to chase your man well, acceleration needs to be toned down. Need to memorize dribble moves, although controls are somewhat intuitive. -UI a little confusing sometimesYou won't see important tooltips if you use a mouse, gotta use a controller. Took me a while to find out how to create a new character. Also lack of a manual can make it hard for newbies, like not knowing how to get badges or what certain attributes do (really depended on youtube).-xbox one controller a little weirdCan't use right stick aim properly, degrees always off center. Don't have this problem with other controllers.-Other suggestions for developersDon't like the virtual currency concept, makes the game like a pay to win (or pay to save time). Would be nice to skip movies or a watch later option. Also make transition scenes faster to make it easier for grinders. Also my game settings keep resetting even though I saved them. But other than that a great iteration.Looking for an alternative? Try Freestyle2: Street Basketball (seems fine except for the passing and blocking dunks)

content:
Posted: September 28, 2016
												I've been a big fan of basketball and sports in general for a large majority of my life. I bought 2K16 during the summer sale, and it was one of the best sports games I have personally ever played. I took a chance and preordered this (Legendary Gold Edition. I know, I'm ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.), and I doubt I could be more satisfied. There are many improvements from 2K16. I realize I'm being vague but oh well. I highly recommend this game, first twelve days of release (Early Access from preorder) and I'm already at 25 hours. I give it a 9/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 28, 2016
												I'm the type of person who buys NBA 2k every year. I like the franchise mode, quick play, and messing around with the historical teams. I almost always purchase the game on xbox/ps4 and when I haven't I've kind of regret it. Normally even though I've had a PC way above 2k's recommended specs the game always seemed to be worst on pc. Controller support was never what I wanted, game seemed to run poorly, and I just felt the experience was better on console.I purchased NBA 2k16 last year on PS4 and hated it. The mechanics of the game felt broken, it seemed to run worse than I expected, and the commentary left something to be desired. Specifically a layup was practically impossible, post up shots with trash players were automatic, and any garbage player could block you from a mile away. I had to customize game sliders alot before I got to a playable experiance.I felt so burned by NBA 2k16 that I almost didnt get NBA 2k17. Since I recently upgraded my graphics card (1060) I caved and decided to give NBA 2k17 a shot on PC and I'm glad I did. The game runs very smoothe and looks great on max setting, my controller works perfectly, the physics of the game feel much better, they added a shot meter on layups (I'm a huge fan of this change), and it seems like they made an effort to throw out alot of last years game play.I do wish they'd add better commentary to the throw back teams (they had great commentary in 2k10 or whatever the 1st jordan title was) and I've yet to test online play but I would definately recomend this game to any NBA fan. I'd also say that if your on the fence about PC or Console go PC this time.

content:
Posted: October 4, 2016
												Game is good but defense is annoying in this game and is too buff. The MyPark is highly bias being that shooters (such as my self) have to deal with crappy lag (even though im using ethernet wired connection) while the dunks and layups are press a button and be done with. The sharpshooter has some of the stupidest attribute caps on my career and if you wanna go show out on my park dont try to shoot jumpshots. (my shot meter doesnt even show, one tap and its full making me brick). Bigmen are too fast in this game while guards (unlesh slashers) basically have average speed. If you ask me this game has really good content but the gameplay is trash on my park. The design is too bias and unrealistic being that both curry and irving have really great handles (as all point guards should have) but im stuck on a attribute cap of 79 :( why even bother guarding a center if you cant jump to steal the ball. Oh and ball handling in this game is a joke. one poke and its out. I'm dissapointed in this game. I had so much hopes for it and it only delivered on graphics and new content but the gameplay is aweful being that they over rated defense.

content:
Posted: January 12
												This game has really taken a turn for the worse since 2k15. Its unrealistic. I could handle it when it was making small improvements in the motion and animations department, because the game stayed true to realism. This game has scrapped that and decided realism isnt important anymore. The animations look great, the defense and the way players move feels awesome, but in terms of how realistic the game is in comparison to the actual NBA, this game is awful. For example, I can play MyTeam with an all star team lineup and still to a team like the Atlanta hawks just because every single person on their team can all of a sudden shoot threes at a 100% from minimum 2 shots. And thats not an exaggeration. Every single player (excluding Dwight) that got time in that game from the Atlanta hawks took ATLEAST 2 3 point shots and made atleast 2. (Some made more, some took more). Mean while, I have Steph Curry WIDE open in the corner atleast 4 times and doesnt hit a single one. One of the shots I can understand was a little contested but the other 3 were not. This is just one example. There are many more that have frustrated me over the time that this game has been out and to be quite honest, im ready to uninstall this game. It sucks because I am a major fan of 2K and what they have done with the basketball gaming industry. But theyre getting to above themselves and not listening to fans want like they used to...remind you of any other companies?WOULD NOT RECCOMEND THIS GAME! Go back to 2k15 or even 13.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2016
												When I played 2K16 I remember thinking "Well, this is just minor tweaks over 2K15". 2K17 on the other hand is a massive improvement over last years game. Graphically its a decent step up. Gameplay wise, theres a huge improvement. This year feels more realistic than ever before. I was really impressed with teammate AI. They still do dumb stuff, but they react in really realistic and helpful ways. Like cutting to the basket when youre backing someone down. They tend to move in ways that you can create offense in very fluid and dynamic ways. Its beatiful to watch and very rewarding once you learn how to execute plays and create within the offense. I can make gameplay complaints. Like how it feels impossible to get an offensive rebound even when you have your opponent boxed out. But its all minor complaints and no sports game is perfect. The fact of the matter is that 2K17 is the best basketball game to date. Not just in terms of gameplay but variety as well. I bought 2K17 with full intentions of MyCareer being the mode I spent my time with. Ive yet to even touch it. So far Ive spent all my time with MyTeam which is rediculously addictive. Just within that mode alone theres so much variety of stuff that you can do. The fact that Ive played this game for 69 hours so far and I still havent even played MyCareer, MyGm (which Ive always loved in this series) or PRO-AM, speaks to the unrivaled variety and value this game offers. It even runs great. I didnt buy the game at launch so I dont know how that went. But right now the game is running great and its never once crashed on me. Ive only played a few online matches in MyTeam so far but they were lag free. How the game ran online was a big worry for me, but its been great so far.I was originally going to try everything before I wrote a review, but I see now thats going to be hundreds of gameplay hours from now. Take it from someone who has been playing 2K since the original game on the Dreamcast. Back when Iverson was the only player you needed or wanted on the cover every year. If you love basketball, you want this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19
Product received for free
												After being very disappointed with the lackluster at best titles 2K has put out for the past few years, including 2K16 last year for the PS4, I had no intention of buying 2K17.  The only reason I decided to play it was because of the free to play weekend on Steam.  It was a good chance to try out the game for free plus see how it ran on my newly built gaming PC as I make the transaction from console back to PC.Keep in mind, I NEVER play online, due to cheaters and everyone choosing the Cavs or the Warriors every game.  I also won't review any mode that makes use of VC (myPlayer, myPark, etc).   I have never bought VC and don't plan to because I am very against micro transactions. Because of this, my review is only for offline quick play and offline franchise mode.  Also keep in mind this is my first NBA2K game on the PC so some things I mention may have already been here since I'm comparing it to 2K16 for PS4.After finishing downloading the game I ran a quick play just to get a feel of the game and for the most part the game ran very smooth on my PC.  Graphics are good but since I never played this on my PS4 I don't have anything to compare it to.  Player models are great and look like their real-life counterparts.  There is great detail when you zoom closer and for the arenas I played it, they look true to life.  AI seems somewhat improved from last year, so it doesn't feel like the game is blatantly cheating you (i.e non stop offense rebounds for the CPU, constant missed layups, blocked shots always going back to the CPU, etc).  But I originally said the same thing about 2K16 until I started getting more games in then the cheating became more rampant.  There are still some shake my head moments that I've encountered, like knocking the ball away for an easy fast break score and the player I was controlling would just stop for no reason allowing the CPU to get the ball back.  Also some CPU rebounds seemed highly unlikely but for the most part these are toned down from last year. (so far)I also like the ability to coach and run plays on the fly, it took some getting used to, but I finally started getting the hang of it at the end of my free to play period.  Another thing I really like about the presentation is how the game switches up the broadcasting crew.  Last year it was Kevin Harlan, Greg Anthony, and Clark Kellogg every single game, but this year they have random announcers each game, sometimes it would be the crew I mentioned above, other times it would be Doris Burke, Steve Smith, Chris Webber, and a couple of others.  Its a break from the monotonous broadcasting in previous years.  I suspect however if you play a lot of games, even the new broadcasting approach would get old.   The pregame, halftime and post game crew is still Kenny, Ernie, and Shaq and they have some new dialogue, but even during my free period they started repeating themselves.Franchise mode is pretty much the same from last year.  So everything from 2K16 is still here including some problems:1.)  Like 2K16, If you edit your team's jersey, you cannot easily go back to the default uniforms without downloading them back from the 2K community.2.)  NBA Championship celebration is still lackluster as always.  No locker room celebrations from what I saw; just a few seconds of celebrations from the players, and then it just skips to the trophy presentation, then cuts to the MVP holding the MVP trophy.   I will say the ring ceremony the following season is a little better than 2K16.  In addition to my complaint on this, also if your team had won its first championship the previous season, they get no championship patch on the back of their jerseys like they do in real life.  Also, if your time adds a title, then the trophy count does not increment.  This may be hard to implement, so it is nitpicking, but at the minimum it should at least add the patch.3.)  This year added the money ball rack to the All star weekend 3pt contest, but there is no way to place your money ball rack in the All star weekend 3 point competition like they can do in real life.  For every player its always the last rack. 4.)  Dunk contest is the same as last year with the exact same dunks.  5.)  All star game still shows Air Canada Centre on the center billboard, even though the court says New Orleans.  Also on All Star Saturday, the court is clearly still in Toronto.6.)   In 2K16, the Raptors jerseys had the all star patch on them even when entering later years in your franchise, I didn't get to confirm that this still occurs this year with the Pelicans, but I am sure its still there.Despite the issues, its a pretty good game offline speaking, but I feel I could get bored with it after a while.  As I said before, I'll never play online, and that is where it seems most of the issues lie.The only way I can begin to recommend this game is if you are strictly offline and only if you can get it for around $30.  $60 is just too much to pay if you are only going to use it for off line play.  I enjoyed my free play but even with the $39 sale price this weekend, I still won't get it. If it comes down to $30 down the road, I may consider itI'm on the fence with this one, aside from a few additions there is nothing really new here and many of the issues and oversights from last year carry over to this year.  If you do any online play, then I would say pass on this one.  If you are strictly offline play, then wait until it goes down to $30 or so because its not worth the full price tag.For reference my PC specs are as follows and I had no performance issues with game play.Intel i5 6600Geforce GTX 1070ASUS Z170E16 GB DDR4 SDRAM2 TB 3.5 HD480 GB SSDWindows 10

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2016
												Poor keyboard support and frustrating navigation of menus.No way of skipping cutscenes. Most of them are long and have no player influence.Less responsive gameplay than 2k13 or 2k15.Extended Review after 200+ hours of gameplay and numerous patches:This game is still badly broken and by far the least fun I've had playing a 2K game. Gameplay issues that have plagued all previous titles - Bad help defence, constant terrible double teams, your character being stuck in cement and running in quicksand, teammates going out of their way to brick wall you, broken pass selection, teammates still allowing way too many rebounds etc. etc. are all features of this title once again.They also made fouls and turnovers even more frequent. As usual, fouls in the paint are a given, but add to that virtually every steal attempt and more regular fouls on jumpshots. Meanwhile the AI can strip you at will without even a steal animation.Onto the bugs that have destroyed the game thanks in part to the stupid archetypes that severely limit the kind of character you can create.My first character was a shot creator PG pre-patches. I played the full 82 game season and abandoned the character, the first character I've even given up on because the shot timing and badges were/still are bugged made every shot an F other than open dunks.My second was a Glass Cleaner C and after some patches were finally released, it was fun for a little while, minus all the frustrations listed above from previous versions. But after unlocking almost all of the badges and winning a championship, I was ready to go back to a guard role.Thinking that maybe the game would be fixed by now, I created a Slasher SG and was going okay until unlocking the badge Relentless Finisher, which started bugged, was fixed, and is bugged again. Every layup is an F and will miss.Welcome back to Free Throw Simulator 2k17..3 characters, 2 abandoned. 2K have already released multiple patches and hotfixes and I doubt they will continue much longer. The game is unfortunately broken trash.
