content:
Posted: March 3
												So, I'm going to be pretty negative with this one. First off, the gameplay and graphics feel and look like this is a 2008 video game... It's on PC, is supposed to be "nextGen" visuals, and it isn't. NBA 2k13 looks better than this game does... and thats nearly 5 full games ago! The scan a face tool, well it's annoying at best to use. Not very optimally created. The game as a whole, unless you have a PC powerful enough to run 4k, looks like complete crap. The MyPLAYER mode was an improvement in my mind. Giving a legitimate depth and story to YOUR career, FIFA 17 did this with a static pre-made character and it was phenomenal, so thumbs up there 2K! Other issues include shotty internet connections and speeds (and I DO have good internet, seeing I can host 6 people all on an MMO on my internet at the same time with no major issues). So I'd rate this game a 2/10. Definitely cut corners compared to console and is most certainly NOT worth 60 dollars.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												A little about me. I have 332 hours in NBA2K16. ALL those hours are Franchise mode playing EVERY game @ 9 minutes quarters including playoffs (On Superstar Diff.). I have NEVER played any other game mode honestly. So now you know how I play the game I wanna talk about this year compared to last from a Franchise mode players perspective except all I want to talk about is controls. THEY ARE HORRIBLE!!!! I find myself flying around the court almost out of control on defense. On offense I found directional passing really off and throwing bad passes to people I wasnt even aiming for. The shot meter is different too and I was willing to give it a couple games to adjust before berating it but after 12 hours I was still shooting horribly and sometime I would slightly move the stick and my player would do a full move almost automatically (and get blocked). That mostly happend when I would try to pump fake (couldnt do it). I was getting super frustrated and even had to drop the difficulty to no avail. It was not fun and I LOVE the NBA 2K series. Im going back to 2K16 tho and continue my franchise :)If you already own and played a lot of 2K16 I do not recommend. If you're new you wont know any better so go for it.

content:
Posted: September 19, 2016
												So this time they released the 2k15 physics with updated models. I recognize the same silliness that was present 2 years ago and not in the last edition of the game. What a pile of♥♥♥♥♥♥ 2K is really going on stagnation this time. Some healthy competition is very much needed.EDIT:It is superior to 2k15 physics, but inferior to 2k16. Luckily I was able to refund 2k17 and will get my NBA fix by playing 2k16.I have played NBA on PC (only) since NBA Live 96. I played NBA InsideDrive 2000 for 3 years straight - Live could not top it, until 2004. 2k7 was the very first 2k editon of NBA for PC and year after year it has been stadily improved (the 5 on 5 basketball simulation). So to me it is sad to see the decline of gamplay physics in this year editions - just slightly tuned 2k15. Just to name a few "features" that made the comeback: - missed 3pointers go 80% out of bounds (sic). That means no risk of missing a perimeter shot and facing a opponents fastbreak attack - on defense, when  you switch to anoter player (usually to stop a fastbreak) - when switch happens, the ongoing animation stops - the player is suddenly standing still. Stopping fastbreaks is impossible with this glitch. - overall gameplay and animations are much less smooth. Teamates AI is less intelligent which was major improvement in 2k16So yeah, I am a big fan of basketball simulation and currently there is a better game on the market than this. It's 2k16.

												Incredible basketball game, just wish they would put the same effort into the PC port.  As you can see by my hours played, I have put a lot into this years game (not to mention previosu years).  Most of that time is in my GM.  I just had the game glitch and delete both my main files as I exited playing.  That is over 800 hrs of gameplay lost...I have noticed this issues when going past about 2 different saves, but these were the only 2 saves I had.  This has never been an issue on console.  When you combine this with my 2k14 pc problem (was literally locked out bc of a key-gen issue for months and it took 2k the better part of a month just to issue a new key ~ all save data lost there too), it is safe to say this will probably be the last time I buy this for PC barring drastic changes)P.S.  I decided to cover a personal issue, because it is beating a dead horse to talk about how the PC community is ignored as far as optimization and online servers.In 2017 this is unacceptable!  Look at a game like Rocket League(RL).  While more simplistic, both are physics based games.  In RL, cross platform play is standard, and I cant even play another PC player successfully in 2k.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2016
												NBA 2K17,I clocked almost 200 hours into this game so I think its time for a review of this game.Singleplayer:Playnow:What can I say about it nothing new, blacktop is great if you play a player they dont have their jerseys, you have a crowd. And the place its set up is actually awesome.Mycareer: Mycareer changed alot it now features Archetypes (NBA 2K17 biggest and only feature) It looked good at the trailer but I actually realised thats its bad real bad. Lets say I want to be glasscleaner eating boards, but I also want to shoot - NOPE you can't do that you cant be Demarcus Cousins or any of the great NBA centers/powerforwards. Cause I'm sure there are Shooting centers that grab rebounds, but 2K placed a cap on this so you cant shoot very well. Oh yeah, myplayer still sounds black, for the people that have problems with it, its perfectly fine for me. The Myplayer creation ugh, its AWFUL nothing new! No new haircuts but THEY gave the NBA players their good haircuts lets say Jimmy Butler, he got his haircut really good at this game but they dont have an option for us to wear it. The Story is good, why good you say? Cause its better then 2K16's. MyLeague/MyGM:This was the gamemode where I didnt find any bugs/glitches, MyGM and Myleague(Online) is still there you also have ''Start Today'' where you play as your favourite NBA team and start where the team left off with all real NBA stats, standings and injuries. you also have ''Season'' where you just play one season and ''playoff) where you play in the playoffs. They also have this new thing called ''League Expansion'' with that you can start the league with the 30 current NBA teams and have 6 extra teams! (Awesome), You can then create your own team or use a pre-built team or Download it. Myleague is just great no problems.ONLINE:MyPark:Its just like 2K16 good or bad?ITS BAD, there are hackers, Glasscleaners that can shoot 3's. Rookies with all the mypark badges and 99.The worst thing is Mypark is the same the PARKS are the same except Rivet city but that just went ugly. They dont have voicechat which is good thing or bad thing you may choose. I'm not even talking about park anymore. NEXT!let me say one more thing its capped at 60 fps!ProAm: Its cool, no hackers found yet and there are actually people in it, its still hard to find but better then 2k16.MyTeam: Packluck is alot better then 2k16 you get better card wayyy better.Playnow Online: I wanted to try it once but after 5 minutes searching for a player, I gave up. I'll update this when I actually played it.GAMEPLAY: Gameplay is really smooth, alot smoother then 2K16 you cant spam skillmoves anymore cause your player will get tired you actually control the skillmoves and its now not who can spam its now who can control the sticks better. I thought they fixed that double team glitch but its still there anyone tell me?Graphics:Graphics are amazing a huge improvement from 2K16 I also see the emotion from players. I play this at Ultra settings and it looks amazing definitely a + for them. It runs buttery smooth.But this is really annoying,This is grindgame a VC/attribute grind game. MYCAREER is so grindy its really annoying it took forever to upgrade my playmaker and they actually force you to buy VC cause grinding on MYCAREER is to annoying but yeah its 2K.And this is my review: Score: 8/10 fix the damn game 2K.Should YOU get it? For this price now wait for now, when its on sale for like 30 bucks or sumthing.But I do recommend it.

content:
Posted: March 22
												I'd like to start off immediately by saying that I do not play this game online. I'm well aware that cheating is a major issue that needs to be addressed, but online play in 2k (sports games in general honestly) has personally never been my thing. As I can't say anything about the pros/cons of online play for this game, this review will be purely based off of my experience playing the offline mods.I really, really do enjoy this game. For starters, it looks great. 97% of the players look extremley realistic and the courts look amazing. The in game commentary is starting to get much better and you'll rarely hear repeated dialogue throughout a single game. Game mechanics seem like they're getting better too and the biggest update I've noticed about this from last year's game is that the player's movement seems much more fluent. On higher difficulties it can be very hard sometimes as making careless passes or taking bad shots will almost certainly put you in position to get blown out by the A.I.... you don't have a lot of room for error, but it's easy to catch on to this and break bad habits to run more efficent offenses and better defenses. There's plenty of plays and sets as well as defensive adjustments to either keep you in the lead or help you come back if you're trailing too. MyCareer is much better this year. I personally had a massive love/hate relationship with last year's MyCareer as the actual idea of it and the gameplay was fantastic, but the in depth story, cut scenes and drama made me almost stop playing it on more than one occasion. This year has less of a focus on your player's personal life and more about his basketball life and career, which is a very good thing. I haven't messed with MyTeam too much, but from the time I have spent in the mode it's pretty solid. The challenges are entertaining and I've had pretty fair luck (equal amount of good and bad pulls) with my pulls from card packs. MyLeague is pretty much the exact same thing it's been for years, which is a good thing in my opinion. Play games, trade/sign/cut players, scout rookies for the upcoming draft, etc... 2k didn't do anything to change this mode and that's perfectly fine with me. Why fix something that isn't broken? You also, as usual, have the ability to edit and update the rosters and then use those edited rosters in exhibition games, MyLeague, etc., which I find very useful because I tend to disagree with a lot of the ratings that 2k gives some of the players. The game is not perfect though. Starting with in game issues.... I believe the shooting needs adjustment. When playing on All Star difficulty or higher, it can sometimes be extremley difficult to even make a shot.. and I'm talking like realistic NBA level shots. For instance, 8/10 times I will miss lightly contested mid range jumpers with Andre Iguodala. I'm well aware that he's not a premier shooter, but this is a shot that any NBA player would be able to hit at least 50% of the time, but unless you get a perfect shot release, it's most likely not going to go in. I can understand when Steph Curry misses 3s from near the half court logo.... but when he puts up brick after brick with light defense from 3 unless you get a perfect release? That needs adjustment, especially when the second your defense gets light, the A.I. will knock down shot after shot. A.I.'s ability to steal the ball compared to what you're capable of is also very lopsided. You make a lazy pass and it's definitely going to get stolen, yet there's times when I've actually had the A.I. pass the ball THROUGH my player and the ball didn't even get deflected. A.I,s on your team are pretty much useless compared to the ones you're facing and will regularly get burnt on defense (or do absaolutely nothing on offense) with you being able to do nothing about this. The game focuses too much on replays, interviews and the halftime report. The interviews with players that it shows 1-2 times a game look terrible and the halftime report is so overdone and unnecessary... While the overall player movement is very fluent, the one issue I have is that if you ever get to close to the sideline with a player that doesn't have the ball, then your player will most likely fall into the stands and be taken out of the play for a good 5-6 seconds... it's a very unnecessary and frustrating action that shouldn't even be put in the game. MyCareer is much better than last year, but the biggest issue I have is the upgrading system. At the beginning-ish time of your Career you'll select a play style for your player and you'll have corresponding attributes that are able to be upgraded higher and others that will seem to have a level cap. For instance, my player is more of a slashing PG, so I can pretty much max out my passing, agility, driving capabilities, defending, etc., but my mid range and three point shooting attributes can only be upgraded so high... I'm only done with one full season so I'm not sure if this can be adjusted or what at some point, but if it can't then that's really annoying as it makes it difficult for you to create a really well rounded player. You're also forced to actually attend your team practices during the week (you can however just quit the second your player gets into the gym with no penalty, but it still takes about a minute of your time for something you probably didn't want to do in the first place). If you miss practice, you'll get a nice text from your coach and then you'll lose minutes for the next game. Kind of annoying because all I want to do is you know, play in the games, but oh well... My game has on more than one occasion crashed when I left it paused to go do something (use the bathroom, make food, etc.). My computer has more than capable specs to run this game so I have no idea why this would happen, but it hasn't happened enough to really be that big of an issue to me. I'd like to address that regardless though for the sake of the review. While it may seem like I focused more on the issues rather than the positives, that's simply because in my opinion this game doesn't have very many problems (again, only talking about the offline portion) so I tried to go as in detail as I could with the few issues I had with the game. Overall I'd give the game a 9/10. It looks great, plays very smooth and has a plethora of modes and things to do to keep you more than busy. Minor issues could definitely be fixed either through an update or by just addressing them in next year's game, but regardless it's still a great and fun game and I'll definitely be buying 2K18 as well.

As i've learned before winning is just really boring if you just win over and over and over again. I just want competitive gameplay. 2. Teammates cannot shoot sometimes 3. Why can't I just not do Justice because if I want to leave it still goes with Justice or if you wait until the second season he goes with you. You cannot escape. Sorry but after a while even orange juice just starts to taste bad, 4. The shot meter. Lord help me. The 2k15 shot meter was actually decent and it is so hard to get a good shot in 2k17. Almost common to sometimes go 0-7 in the first half. 5. If you aren't a playmaker, sharpshooter, or stretch big have fun. 6. Why can't I skip the cut scenes that I clearly don't give any craps about. If anyone that makes NBA 2k games sees this please take this as criticism because I really wanted to give this game a thumbs up but when in Pro you can win by 40 over and over again, and in HOF Kevin Durant gets 50 in 3 games and no one on my team can shoot then please change something. AND PLEASE make all levels competitive please. pleaseThanks.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 24, 2016
												NBA2k17, like its other parts, is a simulator that has perhaps the greatest career mode in all of sports games. But it is not without its many, many flaws.For every two things that 2k fixes, they take one step back. This game is filled with bugs, glitches, graphical errors, unpolished animations, physics and unfair gameplay. Fake bumps, borderline idiotic AI, slider controls that artificially make the game more difficult by creating unfair play, and unrealistic expectations. 2K is excellent at portraying a level of depth in an NBA superstar unlike any other game, and if you're willing to put up with the irritations, then the game is an excellent addition.TL;DR: Buy it if you're willing to put up with it. It is an excellent game, flawed, but excellent.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 25, 2016
												So far the game is great. Don't understand all the negative reviews. I've played 2k11, 14, 15, and 16 and this career mode is by far the best.  Way less cheesy than last year. Still need more time to talk about the gameplay, but most issues can likely be fixed with sliders eventually.  The rebounding in this game is a million times better than last year. You have long rebounds and tip outs/ins. Little guys arent able to consistantly outrebound big guys like before. Air balls finally happen. Animations for layups look better, and you don't just miss layups simply because there was someone in the area.  Also there is release timing for layups now.  As usual your character starts with far too low stats simply because 2k is greedy af.  you enter the nba as like a 55 overall while all the other first round picks are in the high 70s.  The college gameplay is great tho, you have the option to skip it if you want too.  It isn't completely scripted, you have to win the semifinals to move on to the national championship. Dont get to choose to stay in college for more years tho.  The thing where you can swap control with justice is cheese af please give us the option to turn it off.  You go to optional practices in order to unlock upgrades which is cool but would be nice if we also got some vc or stat boosts.  Haven't experienced any lag or crash issues whatsoever. I have a gtx 970 and i5. My guess is it is only optimized for nvidia cards. Will update this review after I play more career and myleague, but for now it's a lot of fun.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 24, 2016
												Better game, worse value. TLDR: Better game, extremely bad grinding pushing you towards paying for virtual coins So 2k17 is a better game than 2k16. My career is interesting and better paced, my league, normal games are all improved.The biggest problem is how hard buying virtual coins for your player or myteam is pushed.First my career. Basically everything you do give you less VC, everything costs more vc to buy ingame, pushing you harder towards spending real money that btw costs 50% more than last year.Add in archetypes, were you can do a few things really well on a player. This means that if you want to start a new character you have to grind 50+ hours to earn enough vc to even be ok online. Or spend 50 euroes extra on this full price game and skip that part. Its a scummy business model that is being pushed hard. You wont stand a change online if you dont have a player with some 89 overall.My team is no better with taxes on everything set in place to reduce your chances of earning money on the auction house.The game is good. If money is no issue for you and you like basketball, it wont get any better. If you dont have money to flush though, you better have nothing else to do, as this game takes forever to grind without.

Even after the new patch, I had one of the worst experiences I've ever had with a video game. Sorry 2K. You've lost my trust. Coming from someone who has blindly supported and bought your games every year just because I loved the franchise that much. Going back to 2K16 for good.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 4, 2016
												I gotta say that this game is great visually, the graphics, smooth movements and everything is awesome, BUT there are too many bugs in the game. For example, behind the back dribbles are not working(Shout out to developers! Please fix this!); another one is you  can't go straight to the gym you have to first do some training with your teammates who's in the court (in PS4 you can go straight to the gym and skip the trainings offered by your teammates). It's really annoying since I have to wait until one of them ask me to play with them even when I press LT+RT they still take time to do the training with me. Another bug is sometimes the loading screen is stuck under 92% in the pre game show I have to close and restart the game. One more bug that really annoy me is when you are in training with your teammates in the gym, like when in 3v3 and then you call a double team there's a chance that your controls will not work except your move and shoot control, every other thing will freeze and you will not be able to gain it back until you exit the gym.  Anyway, that were some of the bugs that really get into my nerve everytime I play this game. Another thing that I hate in this game is it's not designed to be played offline on mycareer. You can't even customize/buy anything offline and you can't use your online player on offline games. I was hoping something like I can play offline and then when I connect online later it will be uploaded to cloud or something like that. But it's really sad that this game is trying to be like "NBA2KOnline (currently in China server)" or "Freestyle" which are a MMO sports game in which buying ingame coins is common and those games were free to play unlike this game its buy to play and at the same time pay to win which I really think not a good move by there marketing staff. I really got no complain with grinding and all because that makes the game so satisfying when you see your player getting really good after a lot of grinding so why would I spend money buying all the stats and items when I can get that in game? Real gamers don't do that it takes away the fun in the game atleast that's what I thought. It feels llike they are really desperate to gain some money. That is why I DO NOT RECOMMEND this game and I wouldn't probably buy 2k18 in the future if it's most likely the same as this one. If you really want to play this game then play it in the console(PS4/Xbox).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 11, 2016
												I must say this game is great, but many gliches and flaws. Most of them are not game breaking, but the amount of frustation they add up is game breaking. I played 2k15 and acually liked how each position can eventually reach the same maximum attributes, but not anymore as playing type came back, forcing me to play myteam, my second favorite mode. When one of the other team's players penatrates inside from the left and I press A to switch, a guard 15 feet inside the 3 pt line will be selected instead of a center right behind the ball handler. The best guess is that the game automataclly selects the nearest player in front of the ball handler no matter how close your defender behind him is. Back in 2k14 and 15 it was not used to be like this. Althuogh I am fine with layups being timed, having 4 buttons just for passing is ridiculous. Most of the time icon pass and simply A is the only thing I need. Also, Lebron is so underpowered in shooting and dribbling that he plays like an athletic center who can pass. Auto defense for fastbreak is pretty broken. Unless I control them, my players will all crowd inside the paint with no opposing players inside 3pt line, who will just hit an eazy 3. When I defend a ballhandler, sometimes a random bigman will come up and push my player all the way from 3pt to the paint as if hes trying to get pass him in a slow motion, again resulting in an eazy 3. Small problems like this are countless, and are defentily game breaking when they add up.

content:
Posted: October 22, 2016
												NBA2K17 is not a bad game at all, BUT it is filled with annoying situations (bugs etc.). If you are a fan of Basketball, you like to play regular NBA-Games or play as a GM, you will have much fun with this game, for sure. If you play online modes and likes to accept that you will play against many cheater (like in the PARK or the ProAm modus) buy the game! 2K will not fix that problem for you! So buy it and get online♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥of. ...and stay happy if you are foolish enough (like me sometimes) to compete against those players.Additionally I have to say, please do not go berserk if you just earned VirtualCredits or MYTeam-Points, and they will never be added to your account (mostly because of connection-error). So my positive/negative summary:+ really good game engine+ creative possibilities to play the game on court+ your myCareer player is NO allaround monster+ deep possibilities to play as a GM- still filled with cheaters online (like in the last games)- many connection problems (for several of my friends) while getting your VC or MT - released with many bugs (player without skin etc.)- Kobe Bryant edition is a bad bad joke of 2KSports to earn just money (you lose your Kobe after 5 Games ;) )

												An overall upgraded experience from NBA2K16. Not neccesarily worth the price of the Legendary editions but the standard edition is worth the price. I have yet to experience any of the bugs or lag issues reported by others on my 5 year old Alienware laptop with an NVIDIA GTX graphics card.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 17, 2016
												They took the criticism for 2K16 to heart and fixed what was wrong with MyCareer. The story is WAY better than 2k16, and also far less intrusive. The only con is that you can't skip cut scenes. But that's not that big of an issue, because the story for once is actually FUN and ENJOYABLE. Who knew they could do that? :DI was close to quitting my loyalty to the series after that debacle with 2K16. Thank goodness they got rid of Spike Lee, because with that trainwreck of a story, I couldn't eat as much as I wanted to puke. But enough of 2K16, this is a different game.Usually My Player is a big man, but after learning about the new skill system for ball handling and even steals, I now run a very nice SG. They worked over the shooting system and it feels much better than previous games. For me it took a few hours of getting to know it, but now I don't want to go back. Now you need actual skill to sink your shots, at least on higher difficulties. I consider myself an average player, but already on my third NBA game I was able to get a double double and .50 shot percentage on All Star difficulty.With 2KU, they FINALLY gave us back a training center after weirdly missing in 2K16. MyCareer is completely revamped and it is glorious. I'm very happy with the changes. They gave us (optional) shot feedback in training. More training opportunities, a better skill system.People claim that you're being trapped in an archetype when you create your player. That is BS. It determines your initial skill level caps and the skills you're starting with, and some favored badges. There's not much more to it. You have the ability to raise the level caps by spending time and effort in training (probably comparable to the Gym Rat Badge from 2K16). You have plenty opportunity to do so. As I said, I'm now at game 4 of my rookie season and raised my level cap twice. It's easy, and the reward is very good compared to the effort required, especially if you're used to the crawling process of Gym Rat badge upgrades.Gameplay is smoother than previous games and offers more freedom with the Pro Stick. The game looks great, even on my system that is below recommended requirements. It's not bug free, but the few I've come across weren't game breaking at all; rather amusing even, I'd say. Face scan is... a mixed bag. I'd classify my player as an abomination if he wasn't wearing something that should be my facial features, and no afterwork with the sliders has helped. After a few hours with that ugly mug I got used to it.This is the game basketball enthusiasts have been waiting for, even if they haven't known that yet. It's the best game of the series up to this point, and actually worth its money.

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 4
												I sadly have to give this game a thumbs down. For a game that retails for $60 (US) (bare bones edition) you get very little. In order to do somewhat decent in MyTeam or MyPlayer you need to Pay to Win.  I can understand the PTW aspect for games that are offerred for free; first they hook you then if you want to progress you have to pay. That shouldn't happen in a game that costs $60 for the bare bones edition. Earning points to advance will take a player forever to accumulate enough to get any worthwhile upgrades. The game has some good points, but the PTW aspect is a big turnoff.Pros:- good control using an  Xbox controller (can't comment on keyboard/mouse control)- when playing NBA 2016 teams, they play close to their abilities, adjusted for the players difficulty level- beginner difficulty level available (not available on XBox 360 stand alone , where player must start at Pro level)- access to past great teams and international teams- graphics are good, no problem with frame rate or clipping (System: Windows 10 Pro, 64 bit              -four i5-3570K CPUs, 3.4 GHzs              - 16 GB memory              - AMD HD 7950, 10 GB memory)Cons:- great content available in MyPlayer and MyTeam, if you are willing to PTW- MyPlayer more about scripted story than actually playing the game.- MyPlayer feels more like a job, with player's time scheduled daily, than actually enjoying playing game. Isn't a game supposed to be fun, not work?- MyTeam requires player to complete "challenges" before actually being able to play MyTeam in a scheduled game (solo).Neutral:- online play. I don't play online against other players. The frustration in the past just not worth it.TL;DR:Controls and Graphics are good, but PTW model for such an expensive game to start ruins it for me. May not for you.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												Usually when I get a new yearly version of 2k it takes me a week or two to get used to the new gameplay and mechanics. This year it took a day before I was back to destroying the computer. There are really no new glaring changes to how the game plays, which is fine given 2k16 was a pretty solid game. However, this year's version really is starting to feel like they slapped on a new coat of paint and did very little otherwise. They changed the menus just for the sake of changing them, and some of them are blatantly more difficult to use such on the fly substitutions. 2k really needs to leave the UI alone if things are not broken, because each year they screw something up and then revert it back the following year. Would not recommend this game if you own last year's version. Held out on this till it was on sale during black friday and I still feel like it wasn't worth the incremental upgrade. Will probably switch to an every other year purchasing cycle for this series from now on.

content:
Posted: October 24, 2016
												Better game, worse value. TLDR: Better game, extremely bad grinding pushing you towards paying for virtual coins So 2k17 is a better game than 2k16. My career is interesting and better paced, my league, normal games are all improved.The biggest problem is how hard buying virtual coins for your player or myteam is pushed.First my career. Basically everything you do give you less VC, everything costs more vc to buy ingame, pushing you harder towards spending real money that btw costs 50% more than last year.Add in archetypes, were you can do a few things really well on a player. This means that if you want to start a new character you have to grind 50+ hours to earn enough vc to even be ok online. Or spend 50 euroes extra on this full price game and skip that part. Its a scummy business model that is being pushed hard. You wont stand a change online if you dont have a player with some 89 overall.My team is no better with taxes on everything set in place to reduce your chances of earning money on the auction house.The game is good. If money is no issue for you and you like basketball, it wont get any better. If you dont have money to flush though, you better have nothing else to do, as this game takes forever to grind without.

content:
Posted: April 4
												I sadly have to give this game a thumbs down. For a game that retails for $60 (US) (bare bones edition) you get very little. In order to do somewhat decent in MyTeam or MyPlayer you need to Pay to Win.  I can understand the PTW aspect for games that are offerred for free; first they hook you then if you want to progress you have to pay. That shouldn't happen in a game that costs $60 for the bare bones edition. Earning points to advance will take a player forever to accumulate enough to get any worthwhile upgrades. The game has some good points, but the PTW aspect is a big turnoff.Pros:- good control using an  Xbox controller (can't comment on keyboard/mouse control)- when playing NBA 2016 teams, they play close to their abilities, adjusted for the players difficulty level- beginner difficulty level available (not available on XBox 360 stand alone , where player must start at Pro level)- access to past great teams and international teams- graphics are good, no problem with frame rate or clipping (System: Windows 10 Pro, 64 bit              -four i5-3570K CPUs, 3.4 GHzs              - 16 GB memory              - AMD HD 7950, 10 GB memory)Cons:- great content available in MyPlayer and MyTeam, if you are willing to PTW- MyPlayer more about scripted story than actually playing the game.- MyPlayer feels more like a job, with player's time scheduled daily, than actually enjoying playing game. Isn't a game supposed to be fun, not work?- MyTeam requires player to complete "challenges" before actually being able to play MyTeam in a scheduled game (solo).Neutral:- online play. I don't play online against other players. The frustration in the past just not worth it.TL;DR:Controls and Graphics are good, but PTW model for such an expensive game to start ruins it for me. May not for you.

content:
Posted: February 10
												So I'll say off the bat this is a fun game to play.  Heavy on the SIM elements, the game isn't much for arcade style play.  I do enjoy franchise mode and I enjoy playing the actual game.That being said, the in game currency..... So in a nutshell, a big part of the game is MyCareer mode.  You create yourself and enter the draft, etc. etc.  Well, to upgrade your guy from absolute♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ you need in game currency points.  Well, those are trickled down to you like Ron Reagan is designing the game.  Probably on average about 200 credits a game.  Well guess what, it takes at least a thousand credits to upgrade at least one point.  So 2k decides to go the EA route and offer these currency points FOR REAL MONEY AS MICROTRANSACTIONS.   And the sad part is, if you don't, enjoy the boring terrible grind.I think I'm more fustrated in the fact that the game is actually good, but these credits are holding that game hostage.  Disapointed.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 5
												This game has unnecessary balancing in myCareer where your teammates will turn over the ball and miss wide open shots so that you cannot set any records.  Not going to lie, I am in December of myCareer and at age 19, my character is extremely good; getting plenty of triple-doubles at only 6'3", 195 lbs.  At times, this game will be going great, everything will be going smoothly until you start getting hall-of-fame level stats.  Then, the balancing comes in where the game will do one of two things: your teammates will refuse to listen to your call for pass, then will take a dumb shot and miss or just turn over the ball; or your shot meter will start to act funky.  There's almost nothing I can do and its pretty easy to tell when the game is about to start trying to balance everything out.  It even ignores me when I'm spamming "A" on my controller to try to get the ball and stop these silly mess-ups; but no the game just goes along with its balancing.  I am hoping that NBA 2K18 is changed back to the old version of myCareer where you aren't forced to play online, as well, in order to get above a 95 overall for your character.  Yes, you heard that right, you must play seemingly hundreds of games online in order to overcome your myCareer cap of 95.  So now your thinking, okay, big deal, you have to play online.  But if you have a 6'3" 195 Shooting Guard, good luck winning any games.  Not only that, but this game's shot meter is extremely confusing.  Even though the arrow is green (perfectly straight aim but supposedly "poor release" with the right joy stick) my player will miss open shots; knowing my release does not even change a millisecond from my other perfect green releases.  Not to mention my character is a sharpshooter with maxed out 3-point shooting.  I know they are trying to make the game more "realistic", but instead they just broke this game.  I can't go back to 2K16 because the shot releases are completely different, too.  It's as if 2K are trying to add unneccessary things to balance the game; yet, are only contributing to the downfall to a once fun, enjoyable game.  2K needs to stop focusing on money and getting people on their online servers and give the NBA OG's our game back.  Thanks.One more note, none of this balancing garbage happens on the game on a Xbox One, I only see this on the computer version.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												Gameplay wise, NBA 2k17 is one of the best sports sims out there. But there's a HUGE caveat.The game features a solid career mode, where you create a player from scratch and work your way to stardom in the NBA. That character can then be taken to MyPark to face off against other players online (more on that later). Another gem is MyGM/League. As you'd expect, you manage a team to a championship, taking care of all the minutia between games.My personal favorite mode is MyTeam. In this mode you build a squad of current and/or former NBA players by collecting their cards. Then test your squad in weekly challenges or face off against historic teams to unlock various rewards. MyTeam also offers competetive online modes, but this is where the issues arise...NBA 2k17's multiplayer is completely broken on PC. Cheaters are rampant and go unchecked by 2k. I litterally can't play the MyTeam Online modes because hackers crash the game before it even starts. Somehow crashing the game gives them a W and me a L while using up my contracts. Like I said, it's an unplayable mess. From what I understand the console versions of the game are mostly fine, so I guess 2k just doesn't care about the PC community. They already got our money...so GG.tl;dr - If you're only interested in singleplayer, this game is a ton of fun. Multiplayer? I wouldn't expect 2K to fix anything at this point. So either buy a console or you're wasting your money.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												Usually when I get a new yearly version of 2k it takes me a week or two to get used to the new gameplay and mechanics. This year it took a day before I was back to destroying the computer. There are really no new glaring changes to how the game plays, which is fine given 2k16 was a pretty solid game. However, this year's version really is starting to feel like they slapped on a new coat of paint and did very little otherwise. They changed the menus just for the sake of changing them, and some of them are blatantly more difficult to use such on the fly substitutions. 2k really needs to leave the UI alone if things are not broken, because each year they screw something up and then revert it back the following year. Would not recommend this game if you own last year's version. Held out on this till it was on sale during black friday and I still feel like it wasn't worth the incremental upgrade. Will probably switch to an every other year purchasing cycle for this series from now on.

content:
Posted: January 18
												So NBA 2k17 is as good as you can get for a sports video game. The game is wasy to pick up and play and looks pretty good. Since I used a controller to play because I dont know who would use a keyboard, but the controls felt fine. But there are some major issues that still need to be fixed. One of the main reasons I got this game was for the My Career I played that all the time, but there are a bunch of bugs on the PC version of this game. One major one being the fact that cutscenes would pop up way before an event would even happen. Example when Denver got cut I saw the one cutscene which was fine, but literally 3 games later it says he is back and we are going to the playoffs. This wouldnt be an issue if it wasnt for the fact I was about 30 games inot the season. So we werent even close to the playoffs, and the other thing is Denver wasnt on my team he was still cut. It wasnt until later that he was back but I had issues with a bunch of cutscenes playing before they should. Another big issue is the player getting stuck and you not being able to move on, after games he would get stuck on another player and I wouldnt be able to go on to the cutscene after the game. I would have to restart the game over and redo the entire mathc i just played. With these bugs a side the game was good but it does take a while to get past 1 season of the game it took me about 70 hours to get through one season. The game is fun and for a basketball game I enjoyed it since it was also my first time playing a NBA game before.

Look at a game like Rocket League(RL).  While more simplistic, both are physics based games.  In RL, cross platform play is standard, and I cant even play another PC player successfully in 2k.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 19, 2016
												---------------- PLEASE READ ----------------First off, if you are fan of Kuroko no Basket stop reading this review and buy the game immediately.Otherwise:Pros:> Great Gameplay - Even more fluid than past iterations, with more animations and potential plays making more more organic looking basketball.> Lots of Teams - In addition to the 30 current NBA teams, 2k17 also offers a selection of european sides and some of the greatest teams of years past such as the '95-'96 Chicago Bulls and the 2000-'01 Philadelphia 76ers. This gives the roster some much appreciated depth allowing you to assemble dream teams of the best players of all time.> Custom Rosters - 2k offer 2 initial rosters to use: the official 2k roster (up-to-date NBA roster) and an injury free roster. But where 2k17 really shines is in its offering of community created custom rosters, such as an All Star roster (the greatest lineup for of all time for each team), a roster where Kobe isn't retired and a Kuroko no Basket roster (Where the 76ers have the generation of miracles and kagami).> Blacktop - Play streetball ranging from 1v1 to 5v5, half-court or full-court. A nice addition which varies the gameplay a little as it feels and plays like the real thing putting emphasis on dribble moves and attacking the paint rather than the perimeter.> MyGM - Exactly what you would hope for from a GM mode in a sports game, nothing to seperate it from the pack but equally nothing really wrong with it either.> MyTeam - Whilst not my prefered mode this mode is akin to Fifa's Ultimate Team and allows you to build your dream NBA sides by collecting player cards, but as to expect from any mode of this nature it is full of necessary consumables and requires you spend money on packs to get a half-decent side. But as far as an Ultimate Team-esque mode goes, MyTeam does just fine.> Soundtrack: A combination of hip-hop and trap music which suites the action of the game well and is varied enough as to not become stale.Cons:> MyCareer - MyCareer fails to deliver, with nothing but long un-skippable cutscenes and grindy and monotonous gameplay to entice you into buying VC via microtransactions. Don't even consider heading online to MyPark or the ProAM without a fully maxed out MyPlayer as you will just be stomped by those who have either played the game for hours upon hours or paid real money in return for stats. This is a greedy move on 2k's part and has ruined a mode which otherwise had the potential to be truly special. This  pay-to-win RPG model works fine in a free-to-play game like Freestyle2: Street Basketball- but in a fully priced AAA release is frankly disgusting and puts a real downer on the whole experience.> Player Base - The PC player base for 2k17 is small to begin with and is highly concentrated in the MyPark and ProAM modes, so if you wish to play MyTeam or exhibition matches online buy the game on console.In Conclusion:If what you are looking for is a fun basketball game to play offline exhibition matches and MyGM then this is a definite buy.However if you are looking for a fufilling career mode or to play online then I recommend that you look elsewhere as this game is pay to win and you will struggle to find a game in the online modes.TL;DR If you want to play offline then definitely buy this, if you want to play online then I recommend that you give this one a miss.

Product received for free
												AI still has some of the same bugs you can find in previous games...from like 6 years ago.Random glitches that stop the story progress in MyCareer, causing a reload. Happened 4 seperate times in 10 hours. One time, a ball got stuck and the AI wouldn't grab a different one in practice, stopping progress. Another time, the ball shot into the sky like it was out of a cannon, never to be seen again..and the referee wouldn't toss a new one, stopping progress. At least it didn't outright freeze or crash on me, I guess.Up big in the 2nd or 3rd? Expect Skynet to take over the other team, ending around the 4 minute mark in the 4th quarter; then expect Larry, Curly, and Moe. Breeds drama, and also makes you enraged when random shmuck #C who gets 6min a game and is 14th off the bench hits a triple to tie, with an expiring shot clock and more guys on him than Sasha Grey.Hackers are everywhere in multiplayer. Play with friends or stick to offline, or you will start thinking everyone is hacking even if they're just good and play the game for 10 hours a day 7 days a week.MyCareer is pretty good, better than the Spike Lee-branded factory of sadness they used previously. It's not The Journey from FIFA, though. Better than average, however.I'd spend, at the most, $20-30 USD on this, so I will wait for a larger sale cut and continue playing my old console version. It's not worth full retail for a face lift with some make-up and a roster update. Madden is not the franchise they should be emulating, in that regard. It pretty much screams "Money grab."

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 9
												This will probably be the first NBA 2K game I don't break into the 100 hours with. The team defense is absolutely horrible this iteration, especially in the MyPlayer mode. People give wide open shots constantly, even on team with good defensive players. They'll simply just leave for their man for no reason. Also the passing is terrible in this game. Professional basketball players seemingly can't make the simplest of passes when on your team, but the AI-controlled team everyone makes a perfect pin-point pass nearly every time. The AI-controlled defense seems to be ready for your passes before your own teammates are. It gets really frustrating when you get nearly 10 turnovers per game in MyPlayer mode while playing as a "playmaking" pass first point guard. But it feels out of your control. And it's not an issue of winning/losing. The best way to win is to just pick and roll over and over again with a good ball handler. But I like to push the ball on fast breaks and do lots of ball movement. It doesn't feel like it's worth it though because the passing is so janky.I've put 100's of hours into the NBA 2K series (maybe Thousands even?), but this is the first time I've ever been so frustrated with things that I just don't even know if I want to come back anymore.

Posted: September 20, 2016
												Bought the game in such a hype... and like last year it deserve a good old red thumb for being unplayable... I'll wait the patch until then it's a redEDIT : What wasn't told is that NVIDIA causes this problem, for those like me, try to right click on your desk go into NVIDIA control panel and then 3D sub menu, here you need to add the game and make it use your latest graphic drivers.... yeah NVIDIA is sooooo good it doesn't make you use the driver it makes you download, TY :) For the game itself, while there are little addition to some sides (historical team), there are a TON of improvement on My Player (a good INTERACTIVE story through your gameplay and SMS, entertaining (albeit blind choices can be upsetting, I think about your shoes) and some good improvement on my GM (you can add up to 6 franchises to play into a new GM mode, you can start at the post season (draft and so on) etc... really good game, and now my graph grief is gone :) enjoy it

EVER. and why my game glitches in 3rd quarter because i refuse to use the terrible "good looking" system they made this year- knicks are not best team in game. why not?i still love this game and would say buy it, challenge me, and prepare to lose. cheers.they need to fix some things and this game will be, again, the best sports simulation game on the market each year for PC.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2016
												This game is broken as f*ck.I haven't tested Online, but I can easily admit that it'll be garbage tooSo, let's divide this in 3 categories, Gameplay, Graphics, Visuals.Let's start with Gameplay.When you start playing this game, you actually expect a real cool gameplay, that will blown your mind, and it does!. Let's start with the move of the players, if you move too heavily to the right/left, you will go across the line and it would be out of bounds, it makes sense innit? But what if I told you that the PC actually goes RUNNING FULL SPEED to the line and they aren't out of bounds. It happens every f*cking time dude, when you are defending for example, you are covering a man to reduce his oportunities to pass the ball, then, when he pass the ball, he actually makes a SUPER STRONG AND FAST PASS, and you would expect it to go out of bounds, then, the PC player is going to pick up the ball while running straight to the sideline, and it would be out of bounds, but NOPE! I don't how, but a invicible wall appears next to the line, and the player won't be out of bounds!! :D Amazing!, right?. But what if you control that player and you pick up that ball, yes... out of bounds -_-Another thing that really♥♥♥♥♥♥me off, is in defense when you try to block someone. For example, a guy comes to the paint and you want to block him, if you are for example, Irving, Curry (or a player that has less than D in block) you will change the player that you are controlling, to the Center that usually has good block stats, when you are your center, you press to block expecting that your Center will jump and try to block that ball, but NOPE! THE ONE THAT IS NEAR THE GUY WITH BALL WILL F*CKING JUMP AND YOU WILL GET A FAULT!!!!!!!!!!!! I mean, if you are covering someone with Curry, you know that you can't f*cking block your opponent, so you change to another player, but this game is going to try to block that guy with CURRY, EVEN IF YOU ARE NOT CONTROLLING HIM!!!!!!!!!!!!!Then, Steals. How the actual ♥♥♥♥ you can get a fault everytime you try to steal someone the ball? But wait, wait, I know you are thinking, "You are just♥♥♥♥♥♥at stealing lol", I'm talking about when you are someone who has a C+ or more in Steals, and you press the botton to steal the ball one single time, and you get a fault! ONLY ONE D*MN TIME!Let's go with GraphicsThe graphics are decent, but what really♥♥♥♥♥♥me off is the cameras, if you try to make a shot when the players are leaving the pitch, DO IT RIGHT!, Everytime I just go across a player and I can see throw him!!! Or I the camera goes throw my coach when he's leaving! like WTF is going on, I don't think that happens in real life bro.Then we have visualsWhat the actual.... Ok, so you trade a player to your team, you would expect a cinematic or something like this new guy showing his jersey, or perhaps some words. NOPE, he just goes to your team like nothing happened!. Then, when you win the actual PLAYOFFS, or even a match, the players just stay there like nothing happened! Or you just see the player moving with his mouth close! LIKE WTF, ♥♥♥♥ING SMILE DUDE OR DO SOMETHING FFSIt's fun, and it's pretty nice, but you'll get tired of this stupid things that happens

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 19
												i'll try to address some problems that in my opinion stand in the way from delivering a good user experience in the game.First off i have to say that i play this game only as a single player experience, and what i'm reviewing is merely based on the "my career" experience.Long story short, this game has been developed year after year to become an arousing and visually stunning experience full of real world references and endorsements. Actual, basketball, gameplay is very marginalized compared to the visual content 2k is adding every year.Going deep into the matter, first we have to think that this is no more a game, it is an industry. This is no more a game of basketball, it is a market broadcast of the NBA itself. What it delivers, and greatly, is about pulling the user of this software into the NBA universe as a whole.This 2k industry is showcasing the NBA brand as a whole. While doing this, they are involving the users in their own social network. This media industry broadcast, ingame, perfectly shot "tv-shows", tries to involve people into their Esport-ish experience, while pulling prizes etcetera.When launching this software, you are gaining axcess to a huge load of content, and statistics, and videos, trivia, easter eggs, etcetera.Being the company mission to sell the NBA brand and to bring more fans and fanatics into the NBA franchise, they have to represent it in a certain way. and they excell in this. Me myself, have started to follow NBA intensively while playing this game over the years.Where does all this i said collide with the gameplay development?As i said, the company tries and delivers the best possible visuals a game could deliver in this videogame era. The animations in the game are, nowadays, countless. For each and every little move, they have a huge database of motion capture material. Most of it taken directly from the NBA players to better represent them. This galvanize, and most importantly, spoil the eye.To link these animations alltogether, yet, is a problem. It's a drawback to the gameplay.To represent a fadeaway and the d from two different build of players, in a realistic way to the eye, means that the control  the player has shall be taken away to a certain degree. Controls in this game are the most unresponsive in ANY sport game to present day. The problem, with this, is that being the company mission what said above, considering this game is almost a monopoly over the genre, and considering the game entertains the players with the huge amount of visual content... considering all that, the controls being unresponsive is not an issue to the 2k industry. The controls being unresponsive, ITS A FEATURE.It's the company "guarantee" that what will be shown on the screen it's visually stunning and entertain to watch, as close to "reality" as possible.THE AI will be the same on any settings, because that's the representation of an NBA game this company wants to show; but most importantly, it's the best they can deliver WHILE fitting the animations alltogether, and all the variables regarding the statistics of every single player potrayed ingame. To make everything believable, numbers HAS to be shown in a believable way. Statistic shall get close to "reality". While this being almost impossible (and ultimately failing to a certain degree, and most surely to the more exigent players), the player in this big hard equation, is a noisance, a variable that the game engine has to control, to limit, so that it won't break the movie the way it has to be potrayed.The path this company has drawn is clear. To better represent the NBA wich they are showcasing, they are sacrificing the freedom and creativity of gameplay. WE ALL HOPE one day they'll solve the franchise problems (listing a few, to represent the most):-defenders sticking like glue to your player, while snapping magically out of hard d when YOU try to defend them-defenders stealing the ball from you as soon as the ball collides to ANY other physical model on the court, while completely ignoring this rule when it's the ai attacking.-passes rresponding to IQ statistics more than player choice (meaning easy assist are a nono, better to pass to the unreachable teammate behind 4 defenders)-space-time continuum obliterations in the extraordinary ability of the defenders to leap in the air or to close up crossing all the fiels in the split of an eye blink just to avoid you to score an easy one.-teammates that neverever GTFO your free path to the basked (and blocking you when you are trying to defend the paint)-and so onWE ALL HOPE that 2K could solve these problems one day.... but as said before, all these facts are not problems from their point of view, these are FEATURES, to represent the NBA game the way they HAVE TO, to SELL the NBA BRAND.If the rules can't be bent for the sake of representation, then the final product would not respect the company mission.So the path is as it follows: the engine is the same every bunch of years, then it's updated, and the series start again. What they do, it's just adding animations. ANIMATIONS ANIMATIONS ANIMATIONS. And make them compatible each other. If something is not scripted, then it's not in the game. if your eye sees a corridor betwean your player and the basket, it doesent mean that the engine is considering that a free lane to the basket. If you see something that the engine it's not enacting, you won't be able to exploit it. period. If you play smart, you get punished. Because game it's inconsistent. You won't jump to grab the rebound until the engine decides it's time for you to jump and get late to it. One time you have to react quickly, the other late, and there's no coherence to this. Because you have to stay on rails, and start to think the gameplay as the engine "thinks" it. You and the ai are not playing with the same set of rules. you are a little mice on a wheel.So, the only hope that gameplay will get smoother and free in time, it's about hoping that 2k will be actually good enough to keep on adding animations until there are so many and so smoothly adjusted together that speed will mean speed, space and time will be respected and not bent, etcetera...BUT, there's no reason to believe this will actyally ever happen.... PROBLEMS WON'T BE SOLVED,  for two main reasons:1- to represent, with endorsements, and with motion capture, and licences and stuff, this big show of the NBA they need HUGE AMOUNTS OF MONEY. -> to get money they are pushing hard the online competition so that people is pulled down into the BUY TO WIN vc market. while wasting real money on stupid shirts and animations, haircuts etcetera -> since the online competition it's so central to the mission to make this game as eye candy as possible, gameplay can't change too much from one game to the other, because the central rule of an E-SPORT is that the game stays the same over time (or people can't become better at it if the rules change).2- Being visually stunning and having build this huge money machine (the two things, as we have seen, are deeply but intricately involved), playing this game spoils the eye and the player to the point that ANY COMPETITION will seem awkward and unpolished in comparison, even if the gameplay of these competing games it's actually BETTER and FUNNIER. Being the sole game on the market, means they have no reason to change and tweak their winning horse.THE GAME IT IS LIKE IT IS, AND IT WON'T CHANGE.Should you buy this game? no. Because you are not the user, you are the product of this big marketing machine.Will you buy this game? in the end, probably, yes. as anybody. Because it's gorgeus, even if horrible at the same time.The worst thing it's that, at 2k, they already know this very well. And planned it. And won.

												OK I just got this a week ago, and while the gameplay is o.k., it has some GLARING and SERIOUS flaws.FIrst of all, they should not call it NBA, it should really be called high school JV 2K17 or NCAA Division 3, because any time you make a long pass about 3 quarters it just goes WAY out of bounds. Also, what is the point of buying this if you know the game will be pretty much useless the next year? number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 23
												Going to try to keep this short and sweet. I love basketball so I play this game a lot. There's really not much competititon out there as far the realistic basketball genre goes, so this is what you're left with. This game isn't garbage by any means, but I would have a hard time reccomening it if you're not a die hard basketball fan. I've been playing the 2k basketball games since 2013 and I can say this by far the buggiest of them all. (In my personal experience.)Positives:-Offline can be fun to goof off in. (So long as you're not including mycareer)-Animations and facial features have definitely improved since 2k16-Decent soundtrack and sound effects.Negatives: -Unplayable online mode. Whether it be the barren wasteland that is 2k online or the UTTER♥♥♥♥♥♥input lag that you experience while playing online, it's quite frankly the worst part of the game imo.-Buggy as all hell. My personal MyCareer character with 70 hours logged is completely broken at this point. It started with getting stuck in practice and unable to leave the gym. (Not game breaking. Just very annoying. Especially since it's a COMPLETE GRIND to earn VC in order to upgrade your character, you have to work them in the gym.) Now it's evolved into everytime I open my phone, the game freezes and it won't allow me to progress. Leaving that mode completely useless at this point.-A complete cash grab if you plan to do anything but quickplay. Whether it be buying cards for your deck or upgrading your character. You can't do anything without VC. Which in order to earn VC, be prepared to grind your♥♥♥♥♥off. (Especially in MyCareer where your early character can barely make a free throw. You can play at a lower difficulty, but the game essentially punishes you for doing so. It will cut the VC you earn in half if you lower the difficulty.) -Complete skill capping in MyCareer. Which basically means if you have any plans to create a KD or Greek Freak type character, you can forget it. You can only progress your characters skill tree to a certain point with each build. So if I create a great dribbler, there's no chance he can be a great shooter. (So that would be a no on a custom Steph Curry as well.)-Difficulty scale very unbalanced. I can't stress enough how much the difficulty jumps from Pro to All-Star. This is best noticed on the 1v1 mode in blacktop. Defense is either mentally handicapped and will allow you to walk by them or they lock you down like glue with no hope of getting around them. They do have the option to custom slide the skills of the CPU you're playing, but the fact this has to be done to accurately adjust your opponent is quite annoying. It becomes literally infuriating. Especially considering my next point....-INPUT LAG. INPUT LAG. INPUT LAG. I CAN'T stress enough how badly this game suffers from this issue. I've gone through settings, forums, and even controllers to fix this issue. But the game is just not built to respond quickly to your commands. Which is fu#$ing horse sh@t in this day and age. (Pardon the language.) But I can't tell you how many times I've wanted to break my controller while defending someone. Because the difficult is not scaled properly, you're left playing on a higher difficuly for realism. (In my case at least.) So that means when you're attempting to guard your oppenent, you're ALWAYS two steps slower than they are. It becomes impossible almost. (Just watch someone play a 1v1 and you'll get what I'm talking about.) And this is just in single player modes. You can forget online modes.Overall, I play it because I love the game of basketball. Not because this game deserves it.
